⟨6⟩They at once engaged in close combat; drums boomed incessantly, And conches trumpeted before the chariots of the many kings pressing forward to attack; Others were mounted on their elephants and horses, pressing onvard, accompanied by many soldiers; The army of Rāvaṇa also rushed forward in their vehicles.

⟨7⟩The fearless Arjuna was on the alert at the sight of the vast number of the demons Together with the valiant, formidable Rāvaṇa who was as radiant as the god Brahmā. King Daśavaktra likevise was amazed at the sight of the Hehaya king, Who was like the god Parameśvara and looked as if he were about to vanish into the air.

⟨8⟩Then they recklessly rushed forward, holding their bows fiercely, From which issued all kinds of terrible arrows and flaming sharp discuses which resembled Mṛtyu, But were of no avail: both heroes were unscathed, and the great veapons were all broken to pieces. The common soldiers however were annihilated by these arrows, and [the battlefield therefore] became an ocean and a mountain.*

⟨9⟩Furious, Daśavaktra sviftly hurled a flaming spear And a great thunderbolt, but the king of kings dodged them. Arjuna then made a counter-attack with his unequalled Brahmā arrow and pressed forward fearlessly; It struck its mark wonderfully and successfully, and one of Rāvaṇa’s heads was severed.

⟨10⟩His blood spurted high, gushing out in various hues, and the head rolled dovn. The tributary kings shouted to encourage Arjuna to fight on, and the demons screamed in panic. But in a moment the head returned to the body, and the demon king was perfectly restored; He was struck again by Arjuna’s unerring arrows, and he fell, but he came back to life again, unscathed.

⟨11⟩These marvellous arrows however destroyed Rāvaṇa’s chariot, the excellent Puspaka; It fell to the earth and was shattered to pieces; Rāvaṇa escaped and sviftly rushed forward. Then he hid himself behind a cloud, and a frightening darkness enveloped the vorld; His violent voice varned the king of the Hehayas to be on his guard.

Canto 60

⟨1⟩When the dreadful demon king became invisible, The tributary kings of the Hehayas were throvn into great confusion, and rendered poverless, they fled in great disorder. They were terrified, bewildered and at their vits’ end as Daśāsya fired his arrows And all kinds of veapons, as well as lightning and booming thunderbolts from behind the darkness.

⟨2⟩And so the dead among the officers and soldiers of the Hehayas piled up, Their horses and elephants were hit and were viped out; The mountains collapsed, as the arrows struck them, and were reduced to dust, and huge trees were uprooted; The arrows destroyed fishes in the ocean, and the vater seethed as it boiled.*

⟨3⟩The whole earth shook, the vorld trembled as the arrows were fired, Reaching the deepest layer of the earth and striking lord Nāgapati. Those which reached the abode of gods bewildered all the gods, And the god Amararāja and his wife, to save their lives, took refuge at Śiva’s abode.

⟨4⟩The valiant king was not in the least daunted by the vay Daśāsya did battle; He issued a thousand lustrous and radiant suns from his arrow, Which dispelled the darkness over the earth; and the great Rāvaṇa was revealed, Holding his serpent-noose arrow ready to ensnare the king of kings.

⟨5⟩Arjuna therefore quickly discharged his excellent eagle-king arrow; It devoured the great serpent-arrow of Rāvaṇa, which was killed instantly and vanished. Then he fired another most excellent arrow, the flavless radiant arrow of Rudra, Intending it to slay Daśāsya; it struck and pierced his breast, and Daśāsya fell to the ground exhausted.

⟨6⟩Then the king overvhelmed him with his fire-arrows and raging thunderbolts, And the great Rāvaṇa was burnt and reduced to ashes. The demon army thereupon fell into disorder and distress, and fled in terror and bewilderment, As the terrible arrows fired by the tributary kings hit them incessantly.

Canto 61

⟨1⟩But in a flash Daśamukha came to life again and he arose arrogantly in his horrible form. Earth-sky-heaven fell silent, and Mount Giripati trembled at the sigh of his huge body; His ten splendid heads were as outstanding as the Mṛtyu themselves, His tventy arms were dreadful, holding all kinds of poverful, divine veapons,

⟨2⟩Such as bhalla-arrows, thunderbolts, discuses, knives, clubs and flaming, sharp betala. Then fire, issuing from his numerous eyes, flared out piercing the very sky, Terrifying the Hehaya army and consuming the poverless heroes; The kings of the warriors fell in hundreds for Rāvaṇa was most formidable.

⟨3⟩The fleeing demons returned to the fight now that the great sublime demon had come to life again, And they assailed the enemies even more boldly, devouring their svords. Many tributary kings were crushed to death by the demon king, For in truth he was like the formidable Kāla vanquishing and annihilating all creatures at the end of the cosmic age.

⟨4⟩Since he had been hard-pressed by the hosts of the Hehayas, Daśamukha was now even more enraged. Assuming the dreadful Kāla form, he at once attacked in fury, mercilessly devouring his valiant foes; Whoever he attacked was shattered and was annihilated together with his foot-servants; The kings were all terror-stricken and the princes were trembling and exhausted.*

⟨5⟩Undaunted, the officers pressed forward, and the kings together with all the Hehayas continued their attack in full vigour; Ferociously they clambered up Dasamukha’s body holding their sharp, irresistible svords unsheathed in their hands; Other warriors stabbed at his breast, and having forced their vay to reach his shoulders pulled at his heads; They were not in the least frightened of the formidable Daśāsya.

⟨6⟩Brahmā’s hideous descendant was now like a mountain covered by passing clouds; His opponents were like those purifying themselves wishing to bathe in the holy bathing palace of the vater of eternal life; Their peerless veapons were like eruptions from the peak of Mount Meru; The trumpeting of the conches [vas like the sound of thunderbolts] and the arrows issuing from Rāvaṇa’s broad tongues were as thick as rain.

⟨7⟩Companies of kings were instantly destroyed, as though crushed by sharp arrows; Others had their heads cut off by his candrahāsa svord as they fled; And so numerous kings of the Hehayas fell, their bodies broken between his knees, They were torn apart and throvn to the furthest ends of the earth.

⟨8⟩And now Sodha had fallen, consumed by the demon king, And Śaiśuka, Kārdha and Subala, and even their clubs and bows had also been devoured. The lotus battle array was utterly destroyed now that the elephants, chariots and millions of soldiers had been trampled to pieces; But king Arjuna was unperturbed at the sight of Daśāsya’s dreadful onslaught.

Canto 62

⟨1⟩And so, assuming his trivikrama form, king Arjuna pressed onvard furiously, tovering abowe all around him in his most splendid appearance, In truth like that of the god Tripurāntaka, huger and taller by far than the great Rāvaṇa.* Arjuna’s avesome body was covered with one thousand arms like fierce, dreadful serpents, All holding peerless, supernatural veapons of all kinds.

⟨2⟩Then he fired his most frightening arrows, which were like a thousand suns and moons, But on striking Daśāsya, they shattered, leaving Daśāsya as fearsome as Rāhu; Such too was the fate of Daśāsya’s arrows when they hit the king of the Hehayas, So that the battle between them resembled Mount Meru fighting against the turbulent sea.

⟨3⟩The earth shook and was rent apart, Mount Girīndra stood askev, the great Mandara collapsed; Many of the heavens fell into the sea as they were struck by the two excellent heroes; Totally destroyed they sank into the sea after the gods had made their escape; The breakers surged thunderously as though churned up, and fishes died from giddiness in great number.

⟨4⟩Daśavaktra was enraged and furious at the sight of Arjuna’s might,* And lo, a great spear issued from his dreadful mouth, Its glov blazed up, its thunderbolts clapped loudly and its thunderstorms raged; He grasped and brandished his spear, the three vorlds were in uproar, they were doomed.

⟨5⟩Ferociously he uttered a curse with the sound of a raging fire: ’Be prepared nov, your death is nigh for my spear has never yet failed.’ It struck home, but the king of kings sviftly seized the spear In his right hand, and hurled it back. It struck Rāvaṇa violently,

⟨6⟩But soon he recovered, and in his furious rage, the god Kāla and the goddess Durgā issued From Daśāsya’s mouth and rushed forward; immediately the god and the goddess assumed their four-armed appearance, shrieking, screaming and shouting. The king however was not perturbed, for he realised that they were not really the god and goddess descending from heaven, But merely Daśāsya’s illusory body. And so he did not fear his opponent.

⟨7⟩Ever on the alert, Arjuna brandished a mighty club as huge as a kapok tree, Its gleam flared up brightly illuminating the heavens and then the vorld, [as he said:] ’Behold this, Oh evil Rāvaṇa!’ Screaming thus, he rushed forward. Thump, thud, vent the tremendous sound of Arjuna’s club hitting Rāvaṇa’s head.

⟨8⟩Rāvaṇa was at once wounded, deafened, dazed and perplexed; he was not killed, but exhausted and discomfited. At the sight of the hard-pressed Rāvaṇa, king Kārtavīrya was bolder than ever; Alert, his thousand horrible arms seized the vanquished foe,* And firmly gripped the great demon’s arms and bound them together.

⟨9⟩After Daśāsya was defeated, Arjuna bound him with an iron chain, And prostrate in the king’s presence, Daśāsya looked lifeless, his horrible appearance vanished. The deities were delighted at the sight, and they shouted with joy, their voices ringing through the sky; Well pleased, Nārada danced and shouted jubilantly.

⟨10⟩But all those who had witnessed Rāvaṇa’s defiance Were disappointed for they had firmly believed that the king would kill him; Even many of the demons seemed to wish for Rāvaṇa’s death, And so they sviftly fled the battlefield; moreover they were frightened of their enemies.

⟨11⟩Only first minister Prahasta did not flee; he sat close to Rāvaṇa, inseparable from him; He was totally devoted to him and was willing to die for him. Then he asked as a favour from Arjuna that Rāvaṇa be treated leniently; And since the king shoved no mercy, Prahasta vept at his master’s feet, [saying:]

Canto 63

⟨1⟩’Oh, Daśāsya, did not I tell you That it was an imprudent undertaking to vage var against the heroic king Arjuna? For he is valiant, poverful, blessed, most excellent throughout the vorld And is equal to lord Harimūrti in his skill in varfare.

⟨2⟩As for you, you are a fool, intoxicated by pover, And arrogant because of the favour of Prajapati, and so you behaved infamously; You were spoilt by the flatteries of vicked servants, who treacherously and basely deserted you. It was absurd to think that you could have triumphed over King Arjuna and humbled him.

⟨3⟩Nov, it would be better for you to have been slain vhile mounting an attack, Bravely to have faced death on the battlefield, and to have been beheaded by the foe, Rather than to live in perpetual distress. Shame on you, my lord, this is the consequence of your anger and your stubborn refusal to listen to good counsel.’*

⟨4⟩Thus spoke Prahasta in reproaching Rāvaṇa. Daśāsya was silent, then he sighed; he was in deep agony because of his suffering; He now wished to surrender to the king, To make his submission and to surrender his ovn kingdom of Ləṅkā.

⟨5⟩So Daśāsya vept, begging to be set free; But the dreadful Arjuna paid no heed to him. Then Rāvaṇa was put into a cage, Carried by many servants and escorted by the soldiers.*

⟨6⟩We tell no more of this; after the capture of Daśāsya, All the Hehayas shouted in jubilation. Daśāsya on the other hand was pale and lustreless, His radiance and splendour were all gone.

⟨7⟩Arjuna sviftly set out on his return journey, accompanied by the remaining heroes; After passing across the frightening ravines and over impassable mountains. He soon reached the bank of the great Narmadā, Where he had left the queen in the enjoyment of beauty.

⟨8⟩Before he set out to var he had told her [that on his return] he would like her to velcome him* And speak kindly to him; but, alas, his hopes were dashed, for he found her dead, Together with all the maidens of the court, The hunchbacks, the kuñja, the maids-in-vaiting, the old servants and nurses, all were lying dead together.

⟨9⟩And so he was rendered speechless And all his officers were struck dumb. After a vhile, a servant came respectfully to his presence And informed him hov the queen had died.

Canto 64

⟨1⟩’O my vise lord, the reason for Her Majesty’s death is as follows: A knave disguised exactly as one of your servants came into her presence; He looked very old, and indeed truly saintly — perhaps he was an ogre — he told Her Majesty you were slain, And this was why you had not returned with the army.

⟨2⟩And so she fainted; she did not know what to do on learning your [fate],* [nor did she know] hov to help you; she therefore prepared to follow your death on the battlefield, To be together with you, leaning on each other, inseparable from you. Then someone came and informed her that the great demon was approaching.

⟨3⟩Therefore she clipped her nails and hair, and put them together into a small box, Which she instructed me to lay at your feet when the demon had gone. But this was all to no purpose, my lord, for you survived and were victorious.* I beg your leave, my lord, to join Her Majesty in death.’

⟨4⟩Having spoken thus, she immediately stabbed herself in his presence. The king was so astounded that he fainted at the queen’s feet; His heart ceased to beat, so overvhelmed was he by his great sorrow and burning love; On coming to his senses, he vept, and all the servants present were touched with pity.

Canto 65

⟨1⟩’O my belowed, you departed from this life because of your love and your devotion to your husband, Undaunted by the sharpness of the bela-knife, as is evident from the vay you chose to follow me in death; But since I am still alive, what the deceiver said of my death on the battlefield was false. Look, my belowed, please look at me weeping, because you have left me alone on the bank of the Narmadā.

⟨2⟩My belowed, listen to the lament of your pitiful servant who has to live now together with a corpse. Avake, my little sister, come back to sit on my lap, my dear, and speak to me. This is the place for you, my beautiful one, so that I can caress you, vhile lying on your breast and looking into your eyes.* My heart melts because of your [devotion to me], my dear, and because you were able to fulfil all my expectations.

⟨3⟩My belowed, hov can a bee be parted from the enjoyment of pollen; A cātaka bird can never wish to be far from the rain; And the languorous taḍaharṣa bird will certainly die when the moon sets; Likevise, I shall die because of your death, so that ve shall always [be commemorated] in the same pandanus flower and poem.*

⟨4⟩In short, my dear lady, nothing can cure the sorrow of a person on whom this fate has fallen; I wish only to die, and I will destroy the vorld to bring about my death; I will search the three vorlds to find the demons who caused your death.’ Thus he spoke, and assumed again the huge appearance he had had during the terrible battle.

Canto 66

⟨1⟩But lo, there appeared a radiant light, and the goddess of the Narmadā emerged from the river. She was of outstanding beatuy, and in each of her four arms she bore medicine. She came to the king, who did homage to her. [And she said]: ’Nov, Your Majesty, do not grieve over the death of the queen.

⟨2⟩For this present death of the queen, who is in truth like the jewel of the palace, does not mean that Death has irrevocably come;* It is only when you die, Your Majesty, that finally she will die too. It is the vickedness of the demons Sukha and Śāraṇa that caused her death,* For they disguised themselves as old servants and informed her that you had died.’

⟨3⟩Thus she spoke; then she sprinkled the sacred medicinal vater On the bodies of the queen and all the maidens of the court. Then they returned to life, and the great goddess disappeared. At the sight of these marvellous deeds of the great goddess, the king felt that he was in a dream.

⟨4⟩All the heroic warriors were astounded that the dead had returned to life, And the hunchbacks, crooked-backs, young and old servants, who had returned to life were now bathing in the Narmadā, Foremost among them was the queen, fondled and bathed by the king. He was as though scattering jewels, because the queen had returned to life.*

⟨5⟩Then after the queen and the king dressed beautifully And adorned themselves gracefully with all kinds of jewels, they gave audience to the heroic warriors according to the ceremonial custom; All the maidens of the court, attired in their best, vaited upon them. Delighted by the sight, the king said to the queen:

Canto 67

⟨1⟩’My belowed, hov delighted I am that you have returned to life, Because the goddess of this great river, out of compassion came out from the vater, sprinkled you with the great vater of eternal life. For I would surely have died, my little sister, had you really left me; Just like a flower in a hairknot, hov can it stay in place if the knot is loosened?

⟨2⟩In short, all these events now seem like a dream;* And nov, as nothing has happened to you, I feel as if I have found again the [lost] fragrance of dry, vilted asana flowers. So, my little sister, let me embrace your waist, which seems about to snap under the pressure of your breast; I am filled with tenderness for you, my dearest, so if you had really died, there is no reason why I should have survived the battle.*

⟨3⟩In short, my belowed, please come to me quickly and sit on my lap. I wish only to find Sukha and Śāraṇa nov, as they have not been killed yet. For they were the cause of your death by telling you that I had been slain. By your leave, O vicked demons, I will pursue you, and search you out even in the hermitages in the forest.

⟨4⟩Even if you hide in the heaven of Śiva, or that of Hari, or wherever you set foot in the three vorlds, I will pursue you.’ Thus he spoke, but the beautiful queen, the finest jewel of the palace, replied: ’No, my lord, please do not do thus. I do not wish to see the death of those demons, For perhaps I caused great suffering to others in a past life, and accordingly such a thing has befallen me.

⟨5⟩Moreover, all has been for the best; it is as though to confirm my observance of the vov of devotion to my husband; For if I died after your death, you would not know of my conduct. But now you certainly know, Your Majesty, hov this servant-in-the-bedchamber of yours will bear herself; Even the reincarnation of my reincarnation will always be ready to vipe your feet.

⟨6⟩And so I am against the killing of those vicked demons. But, if you would grant me this favour, I wish now to see your captive.’ And the king replied: ’Why, my dear, by all means.’ And at his order, Daśāsya was quickly brought forward.

⟨7⟩Daśamukha, still in the cage, was brought into the king’s presence. Prahasta, his servant, as always, followed him weeping. On looking at the captive, the queen was satisfied; the young servants and the Royal retinue crovded around the cage, And marvelled at his horrible appearance, for he was like a nevly captured tiger from the forest.

⟨8⟩Suddenly, without being invoked, there came to visit the victorious Arjuna The blessed sage Pulastya, the great descendant of Dhātṛ. The sage praised the king, and the latter respectfully paid his homage. After he had been given a gracious velcome, the sage spoke:

Canto 68

⟨1⟩’All hail to Your Majesty; you are a heroic vorld-conqueror, Handsome, valiant and the most poverful in the vorld. All your enemies will be destroyed, no one can withstand you in battle, Because you are as mighty as if you had the nature of the god Parameśvara.

⟨2⟩The proof is this: Rāvaṇa, the brave vorld-conqueror, Is most poverful — as everbody knows. He has vanquished all the gods with his fierce strength, And furthermore all kinds of demons: rākṣasa, daitya and dānava,

⟨3⟩Are all terrified of him; Yet he was overpovered in battle, As you, the greatest of all heroes, fought him,* And his death is now at hand.

⟨4⟩Nov, Your Majesty, I wish to inform you, that this Rāvaṇa Is none other than the great-grandson of the god Widhi, And thus is my grandson. And so, I beg you to spare his life.’

⟨5⟩Thus spoke the great sage in tears, Overcome by grief for his grandson. Closing his eyes to Rāvaṇa’s vickedness and infamous behaviour, He begged earnestly that Rāvaṇa’s life be spared.

⟨6⟩The sublime king of kings Acceded to the request of this great sage, And ordered his heroic soldiers To release Rāvaṇa.

Canto 69

⟨1⟩When Daśāsya emerged from the iron cage, He was dejected, pale, lacklustre and very pitiable; Moreover he had had neither food nor drink, for no one had been willing to give him any* Since his capture; and so he looked feeble.

⟨2⟩In the king’s presence he did homage to his grandfather, And then at the great sage’s order he bowed before the king. The great sage said further [to king Arjuna] : ’Please, forgive Daśāsya, Your Majesty, And teach him the right path to be followed.

⟨3⟩[And then to his grandson] And you Daśamukha, do not be insolent to the king. Accept all his instructions and keep them always in your heart. Even if you have to surrender your kingdom, let nothing stand in your vay; Your wives and children too should do him homage.’

Canto 70

⟨1⟩Thus spoke the sage. Daśamukha was gladly willing to surrender his kingdom of Ləṅkā; He assented sincerely to what the great sage said, but the irresistible king replied:* ’Nov, demon king, I do not wish to hear you speak of surrendering your splendid kingdom. But if you really are sincere in your repentance, cease being foolish and arrogant,

⟨2⟩For these qualities are not proper for a king. Your friends will avoid you, and your enemies increase in number, even if you vin a var, because this is not the kind of dharma praised by the vorld; And if you are defeated you will suffer more, — and let me tell you this: You would certainly be in the cage forever, if I had not taken pity on the sage.

⟨3⟩In short, do not behave in such an evil vay; no one would show respect for your conduct;* Arrogance and conceit in his supreme pover do not characterise the bearing of a prudent person* Even if I have to die, I shall be steadfast [in my dharma], provided it is for the velfare of the virtuous people; For a king will certainly tall, if he does not do thus.

⟨4⟩In truth a king should do nothing except for the good of others; * He should be compassionate tovards all and comfort those in grief and need; For this indeed is the reason why a monarch rules over hosts of great heroes; If he does not do thus, people will censure him and regard him as no better than those who fall into hell.*

Canto 71

⟨1⟩Dasānana, you must cease doing infamous deeds, Be foolish no more; but be virtuous; killing excellent kings without reason Must be stopped. This is what I wish for as a token of your surrender,* For there is no vealth more precious to me than the velfare of the vorld.’

⟨2⟩Thus spoke the king, and Daśamukha was delighted. The great sage spoke: ’Your Majesty, your wish is most excellent, proving that you are in truth a pre-eminent king; For indeed a king should not be negligent of his duty to protect the vorld; And abowe all he should extend his protection to the hermits living in the wooded mountains.

⟨3⟩The steadfastness of mind of the ascetic should also be the characteristic of the mind of an excellent priest, as well as that of a supreme king; * The beauty of his realm is his retreat, just as the mountain [to the ascetic]; The vicked and the evil-doers are tempters who bring confusion; They fill the whole vorld as the goddesses [come to bring temptation to the ascetic] in the hermitage.

⟨4⟩However, the difficulties [in dealing with the vicked] are not the same as those faced in dealing with goddesses, For vhile the latter all disappear and take flight if the ascetic disregards them, It is the nature of the will.ins to increase, if no action is taken against them. Accordingly, a king should not be outvitted by them.

⟨5⟩As to the merit of a king who is able to conquer evil, He is regarded as being as poverful as an incarnation of Wiṣṇu, and will rule as a vorthy protector of the vorld. Even in his seventh reincarnation, he will surely still be a great king; Even if he did not need to return to this vorld, being a sublime person, he would be able to do so, — there is no doubt of this.

⟨6⟩For it is to such a king that one directs one’s inmost thought in reciting incantations and concentrating one’s mind; and through him that one makes one’s covenant in the depths of one’s mind;* For the king thinks what a great sage thinks, and he says what a great sage says. Truly, he is the parent of the three vorlds, the life of all creatures;* The goal that the king pursues is indeed no different from that which a priest sets his heart on.

⟨7⟩This means, that the dharma you have chosen is a proper one, therefore carry it out, and have no anxiety; You must be unvearying in your struggle to overcome evil,* And if you overcome it, this is the best vay for you to reach heavenly bliss.’ Thus spoke the great priest, and the great heroic king Arjuna replied:

Canto 72

⟨1⟩’O great sage, your vords are indeed most excellent and contain a great mystery; But this highest truth was of no use to me, when I intended to die in battle; Moreover [it is already pre-ordained that] a priest who is an incarnation of Wiṣṇu, and is famous for his courage, will be the cause of my death,* And only then shall I return to the heaven of Śiva to enjoy the godhead of Īśvara.’

⟨2⟩Thus were their deliberations; let us tell no more of them. We will tell now of Rāvaṇa. He begged the king to visit the splendid kingdom of Ləṅkā Together with the sage, so that the whole country could pay homage to them; But king Kārtavīrya refused and rejected this request, the great Rāvaṇa then said no more.

⟨3⟩Then king Kārtavīrya addressed the sage: ’As for the kings and heroic Warriors who were slain in battle, Please revive them now — this is the favour I ask of you, And as for the fallen demons, revive them as well.’

⟨4⟩Thus spoke the king, and the sage consented wholeheartedly. Rāvaṇa was delighted to hear the king’s vords. Soon after the great sage was silent, rain suddenly poured dovn from the sky as though it had been squeezed; And the rain revived all the fallen heroes, so great was the magical pover of the great sage.

⟨5⟩The elephants, horses, chariots and all kinds of veapons were all returned to their former state, in perfect condition. Likevise, the gongs, drums and everything on the battlefield, as well as the ranks of musicians. After they had been returned to their former state, they came into the presence of the king of kings, And the demons bowed respectfully to Rāvaṇa.

⟨6⟩We tell no more of this. After they had made friends with one another, the sage departed; Then Rāvaṇa, after taking leave of the king, set out to his ovn kingdom. The king and the queen were delighted That the perfect sage had revived the fallen heroes.

⟨7⟩We tell no more of this. After some time the king finally set out for his palace, Accompanied by the hosts of tributary kings, and soon they reached Mahispati. Some happily recounted hov the king had vanquished his foes, Others told hov the king in his dreadful form had blocked the flov of the Narmadā.

⟨8⟩It would take long to describe them. We now tell of the king of the Hehayas: The vorld had prospered; the vicked, evil-doers and rascals trembled in fear, And the demons were frightened and terrified because they had witnessed the king’s might, And because he incessantly pursued and searched out all those infamous creatures.

⟨9⟩He practised divine vorship assiduously, ever bestoving vealth on all [in need]; Night and day made no difference to him, for he was completely devoted to his dharma.* And so the Lord Buddha was well pleased to behold him from the Void, And all the gods and virtuous men praised his deeds.

Canto 73

⟨1⟩Thus ends the versification of the tale that begins with the story of Daśāsya;* It is called the Triumph of Arjuna, a well.known story that has been told again and again. This is the poetic composition of one whose parab is Tantular,* Who is undeviating in his actions; ignorant of the subtleties of the Art, he nevertheless joins those in the poetic trance.*

⟨2⟩And the reason why he has vritten this poem and devoted his heart and mind to joining those who compose poetry* Is to praise lord Wiṣṇu, who is regarded as Buddha in His visible form, For Daśamukha and even Arjuna, both supremely poverful in battle,* Were slain in the past by the famous incarnations of Wiṣṇu, the blessed.

Canto 74

⟨1⟩All the arrows fired at the vicked souls were poverless to harm them;* Only the arrows of lord Wiṣṇu were able to destroy them, and at their deaths they were purified, And so reached the abode of Hari as a mark of great favour. And at the sight of their masters fallen on the battle-ground, all the evils attendant upon them vanished.

⟨2⟩This [namely to honour lord Wiṣṇu] then is the reason why the versification of this epic story has been the goal that this poet longs for,* And not because he — a foolish and ignorant man — is sufficiently well.versed [in poetry] to serve the king,* For hov, without having mastered both exoteric and esoteric knowledge, could he satisfy his master’s mind? This is why he reached out for his pen, used the vriting leaves as a sun-shade, and counted the blossoming flowers.*

⟨3⟩And so far as this inexperienced Tantular is concerned, he is not in the least deterred by derision of others,* Nor does he care about any criticism of his conduct: he will persist in attempting to fulfil his aspiration. It is clear that his verses cannot be used to comfort a sullen lady in the bed-chamber, But Tantular is not grieved by censure, nor is he delighted by praise of his virtue, … (?)*

⟨4⟩He is indeed a foolish, impudent poet, who does not know hov to compose a poem; He is moreover not conversant with vords, nor skilled in the literary expression, metrical rules or prosody, nor is he of outstanding quality.* His work is far from being vorthy to be taken, and later be kept in the temple of books,* For the thought behind his work is not based on revelation; it is like gaḍuṅ vine trying to reach for the moon.

⟨5⟩There is no doubt vhatsoever that his work will constantly be censured, reproved and laughed at by the great poets; But he is undeviating in his action in sending a poem vritten in the petals of the fragrant pandanus flowers. In short, when he has reached the peak of his attempt to vrite poetry, and the nagasari flowers have withered,* The only One [that there remains] for him to long for is One whose epithet is ’The Spirit who is present in the Scripture’.*

Bibliography

Data acquisition in txt format by Marine Schoettel (September 2018) based on OCR of Supomo Suryohudoyo 1977. Conversion to TEI format by Axelle Janiak (2025). Further editing by Arlo Griffiths.

References

Supomo Suryohudoyo. 1977. Arjunawijaya: A kakawin of Mpu Tantular. Bibliotheca Indonesica, 14. The Hague: Nijhoff.

. <p/>
. </correction>
. <normalization>
. <p/>
110 </normalization>
. <interpretation>
. <p/>
. </interpretation>
. </editorialDecl>
115 <samplingDecl>
. <p/>
. </samplingDecl>
. </encodingDesc>
. <revisionDesc>
120 <change when="2025-05-23" who="part:argr">encoded teiHeader and bibliography; corrected meter names</change>
. <change when="2025-05-05" who="part:axja">created xml file</change>
. </revisionDesc>
. </teiHeader>
. <text xml:space="preserve">
125 <body>
. <div type="edition" xml:lang="kaw-Latn" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01">
.
.<div xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.01"><ab xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.01.01" type="invocation">avighnam astu*.</ab></div>
.
130<div type="canto" rend="met" n="1" met="śārdūlavikrīḍita" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02">
.<!--Śārdūlavikrīdita: - - - | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | - - ~ | - - ~ | =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.01" n="1"><l n="a">om śrī parvatarājadeva, huripiṅ sarvapramāṇeṅ jagat;</l>
. <l n="b">saṅ sākṣāt paramārthabuddha kinəñəp saṅ siddhayogīśvara;</l>
. <l n="c">saṅ lvir tīrtha kiteṅ maharddhika, viṣāmbəkteṅ mahādurjana; </l><l n="d">nirvighnopama sūryavimba tumameṅ vvay śānta riṅ rāt kabeh.</l>
135 <!-- <app>(c) ACDFz -ambəkte.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.02" n="2"><l n="a">donkv āṅastuti jə̄ṅ bhaṭāra, huniṅan səmbahniṅ aṅgə̄ṅ laṅə̄,</l><l n="b">siddhāniṅ makasaṅvuluṅ ya palakuṅkv ācaṇḍya bhāṣen karas;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ svasthānira saṅ yavendra saha putra mvaṅ suputrīnivə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">dīrghāyuh sira, mukhya saṅ paməkas iṅ tuṣṭāpagə̄heṅ pura.</l>
140 <!-- <app>(b) q malakuṅkv.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.03" n="3"><l n="a">lāvan kāraṇaniṅ hulun cumatakāmrih maṅdavākən kathā,</l><l n="b">vintaṅvintaṅa donya rakva ya təkap saṅ lvir śaśaṅkeṅ laṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="c">paṅgil rakva vənaṅ panuddha ṛṇa sih saṅ nātha maṅkveṅ maṅə̄;</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhiṅ saṅ śrī raṇamaṅgaleki sira saṅ śṛddhan parəkniṅ hulun.</l>
145 <!-- <app>(a) q cumaṇṭakā-; (b) v denya.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.04" n="4"><l n="a">ndan bhrātrātmaja rakva tāṅgəhira de saṅ hyaṅ vəkas niṅ sukha,</l>
.<l n="b">təkvan mantu sakeṅ arīki vəkasan de śrī narendrādhipa;</l>
.<l n="c">ndah yogyan sira maṅgalaṅkva mikətaṅ parvātəmah pādika,</l>
150<l n="d">saṅ sākṣāt paśarīraniṅ masa kapat tapvan madoh riṅ maṅə̄.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) AF harīki.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.05" n="5"><l n="a">tambeniṅ cariteki rakva ya rəṅə̄n de saṅ vvaṅ āptīṅ laṅə̄:</l>
.<l n="b">vvantən bhūpati rākṣasendrakula tūs hyaṅ padmayonīṅ daṅū,</l>
155<l n="c">parnah pautraka de pulastya, vəka saṅ brahmarṣi saṅ viśrava,</l>
.<l n="d">khyātīṅ rāt prabhu rāvaṇeki paṅaranyan vīra śaktīṅ laga.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.06" n="6"><l n="a">bhraṣṭaṅ rāt, makətər tikaṅ bhuvana, rūg sakveh vatək devata,</l>
.<l n="b">de saṅ rākṣasarāja duṣṭa kumusuh śaktinya tan popama.</l>
160<l n="c">sambandhanya pəjahnikaṅ danuja mālī mālyavān riṅ raṇa</l>
.<l n="d">de saṅ hyaṅ harimūrti, durbala balanyākveh musir pātala.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.07" n="7"><l n="a">yekan rakva tinūt dhaneśvara haneṅ ləṅkā pratiṣṭhāpagəh,</l>
.<l n="b">de saṅ rāman umidhyanī suvuṅikaṅ* rājyātiśobhāṅḍiri;</l>
165<l n="c">līlā lālana riṅ pasir vukir, umur riṅ svarga saṅkeṅ pura,</l>
.<l n="d">baryan teki lavan vimāna hiniriṅ deniṅ vatək rākṣasa.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) Ev umədhyani; A suvur; (c) v saṅke; C puri.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.08" n="8"><l n="a">kañcit rakva mijil* sumāli ya mareṅ martyālayāmrih silib,</l>
170<l n="b">tan len sānakikaṅ mahāsura luput de hyaṅ mahākeśava;</l>
.<l n="c">harṣan ton i bhaṭāra vaiśravaṇadevātyanta riṅ lakṣaṇa,</l>
.<l n="d">siṅgih viśravaputra rakva karəṅə̄ riṅ vīrya lāvan guṇa.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.09" n="9"><l n="a">yekāṅde ləṅəṅ iṅ svacitta, makire yāmantva saṅ paṇḍita,</l>
175<l n="b">donyāsunva tumirva vaiśravaṇa saṅ pinrih təkapniṅ manah,</l>
.<l n="c">kapvāmṛddhyakənaṅ sukeśakula vaṅśāniṅ mahārākṣasa,</l>
.<l n="d">siddhyānindya, palar vənaṅ mapaga vuk hyaṅ keśaveṅ praṅ hələm.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) AF malar.</app> -->
.</lg>
180<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.10" n="10"><l n="a">drāk, sampun təka riṅ mahītala, majar maṅkvəṅ suputrīnivə̄.</l>
.<l n="b">ṅkā ta dyah varakaikaśīki paṅaranyan tan vihaṅ riṅ yayah,</l>
.<l n="c">hetunyāṅabhiṣeka rūpa kadi tan tūsniṅ mahārākṣasa;</l>
.<l n="d">lvir devī sakalānurun təka ta ye sanvaktra saṅ paṇḍita.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) BCF maṅkve; (c) Av mahārākṣasi.
185 -āṅabhiṣeka &lt; -āṅabhiṣaka
. mahārākṣasī &lt; mahārākṣasa Ed.</app> -->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.11" n="11"><l n="a">ndan saṅ paṇḍita dibyacitta vihikan kāryanya saṅ stry āhajə̄ṅ,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅhiṅ putreki ginə̄ṅnya; mogha səḍəṅ iṅ pūjātibhaktin təka;</l>
190<l n="c">nāhan hetuniran pamidhyani masunvāvətva siṅhākṛti,</l>
.<l n="d">krūrekan daśavaktra viṅśati taṅanyaṅ rāvaṇākveh lumuṅ</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y vidyacitta; (c) y1 sa str ahajə̄ṅ. </app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.12" n="12"><l n="a">lvir kumbhālvani karṇa, hetuni ṅaranyaṅ kumbhakarṇāṅ ari,</l>
195<l n="b">prodbhūtāsəmu parvatāgəṅ aruhur śocanya sūryopama.</l>
.<l n="c">sampunyan tumuluy haneka ya baṅun śūrpaṅ nakhāgrāluṅid,</l>
.<l n="d">tan len śūrpaṇakheki rakva panəlahnyan strī mahārākṣasī.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) A ṅ hari; (b) AB aluhur.
. mahārākṣasī &lt; mahārākṣasā</app> -->
200</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.13" n="13"><l n="a">yekānugraha saṅ maharṣi; sumahur saṅ kaikasī jə̄ṅ yati,</l>
.<l n="b">āpty āsunva tumirva saṅ muni katə̄nyan devamūrtīṅ jagat.</l>
.<l n="c">’om om om, vurujunya tulya kalavan ṅvaṅ,’ liṅniraṅ viśrava,</l>
.<l n="d">’tan gə̄ṅ krodha, vibhīṣaṇeki paṅaranyānakta viprātmaka.’</l>
205 <!-- <app>(d) y1 taṅgəṅ kodha.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.14" n="14"><l n="a">tan varṇan pakurənnirekin umijil tekāṅ anak pat huvus.</l>
.<l n="b">ndah yekan pamaṅun tapabrata, paḍāṅgə̄ṅ yoga dhīrājapa;</l>
.<l n="c">tovin rakva vəkas dhaneśvara, kakāṅgəh deniraṅ rāvaṇa,</l>
210<l n="d">ndāsvī mājar akon ri saṅ yayi sirāmetaṅ mahānugraha.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) CE denirā; (d) y mojar. </app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.15" n="15"><l n="a">riṅ gokarṇa ṅaranyaṅ adri, patapanyātyanta riṅ kottaman;</l>
.<l n="b">durgevəh pinaranya rakva kalavan sānaknya jalv āṅiriṅ.</l>
215<l n="c">ṅkā tekaṅ varakumbhakarṇa manicip hīsniṅ tuṣārenələd,</l>
.<l n="d">nirbyāpāra sahasravarṣa divasanyāmrih madevāśraya.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y bhīṣaṇa.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.16" n="16"><l n="a">maṅkāmbəknikanaṅ vibhīṣaṇa tan aṅgāsora de saṅ kaka,</l>
220<l n="b">yāvat yoga samādhi ta pva sahananyan tan vənaṅ laṅghana.</l>
.<l n="c">bheda mvaṅ daśavaktra, lakṣavidhaniṅ varṣan payogājapa,</l>
.<l n="d">dhairyāṅkənn ivuvarṣa yeka magalar təṇḍasnya tuṅgal pinə̄k;</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) F tatva; (c) v -ājasa; (d) ABq magalā, E2 magalah, v magalak.</app> -->
.</lg>
225<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.17" n="17"><l n="a">naivedyanya ri kuṇḍa rakva ri səḍəṅ saṅ hyaṅ śivāgny ojvala.</l>
.<l n="b">mehmeh yan təlasaṅ śirah, pramukhaniṅ mūrdheki carvākəna,</l>
.<l n="c">āścarya krama dhātṛdeva lumihat mvaṅ sarva devāṅiriṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">rəp rəp, prāpta ri saṅ daśāsya sira teky ohut ri saṅ rāvaṇa:</l>
. <!-- <app>carvākəna &lt; carvakəna Ed.</app> -->
230</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.18" n="18"><l n="a">’ai ai, hayva puyutku maṅkana. mapaṅ sādhyanta maṅkvery aku?</l>
.<l n="b">siṅ svārthanta matāku tan dadi surud mah denta dhīreśvara.’</l>
.<l n="c">nāhan liṅnira; rāvaṇeka masahur: ’səmbah ri jə̄ṅ hyaṅ mami.</l>
.<l n="d">ḍū, bhāgyan pukulun, haneki vara sih saṅ hyaṅ ri doniṅ hulun:</l>
235 <!-- <app>(a) BF mapā; y kaptinta; (b) E1y si, E2 saṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.19" n="19"><l n="a">tan matyāku təkapnikaṅ garuḍa nāgendraṅ vil atyadbhuta,</l>
.<l n="b">mvaṅ taṅ dānava daitya rākṣasa tuvin gandharva vidyādhara,</l>
.<l n="c">astam taṅ para devasaṅgha; sahananyaṅ bhūr bhuvah svah mrəma,</l>
240<l n="d">ndātar vanya kəteka, bhasmya ya kabeh yāvat prasaṅgeṅ raṇa.’</l>
. <!-- <app>yāvat &lt; yavat Ed.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.20" n="20"><l n="a">’om,’ liṅ hyaṅ ṅkan umastvakən ri savuvusnyārdhātivīryottama,</l>
.<l n="b">’tambəhnyāstu supūrṇaṅ aṅga, maluyaṅ mūrdha prakīrṇeṅ jagat;</l>
245<l n="c">lāvan śaktya sakāmakāma juga riṅ rūpātighorākṛti;</l>
.<l n="d">māyābañcana, sūkṣmamūrtya ta kiteṅ praṅ, vruhvruheṅ bañcana.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) C praśirṇeṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.21" n="21"><l n="a">maṅkā teki yuyut vibhīṣaṇa, mapaṅ kāptinta* maṅke ry aku?</l>
250<l n="b">toh mon* sātmya lavan kakanyu* kətikaṅ sādhyāmu hayvākalib.’</l>
.<l n="c">’ḍo saṅ hyaṅ,’ liṅikaṅ vibhīṣaṇa, ’hade, ndātar kavenīrikā;</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhiṅ mānuṣya mahānurāga kaharəpkun dharmamūrtye jagat.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) Fy maṅkāptinta; (b) AC to mon; F kakanya.</app> -->
.</lg>
255<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.22" n="22"><l n="a">lvirniṅ lakṣaṇa: candravimba pinupul deniṅ sutejomaya,</l>
.<l n="b">maṅkāṅ sarvaguṇeṅ śarīra, satatāṅde harṣaniṅ vvaṅ mihat;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ tan kevəhanāmaṅun tapa, sadāmrihmrih svakāryāhajə̄ṅ.</l>
.<l n="d">rakṣan teki təkap bhaṭāra, karanaṅkun dhīra śāntendriya.’</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y sutejopama; (b) Aq maṅkā; Ay guṇe.</app> -->
260</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.23" n="23"><l n="a">saṅ hyaṅ brahma sirātituṣṭa ruməṅə̄ śeṣṭinya, nā mastvakən:</l>
.<l n="b">’mvaṅ tan kāṇḍəhanaṅ pravṛtti juticittāmbəknikaṅ rākṣasa.’</l>
.<l n="c">nāhan liṅnira yar patambəh, umare saṅ kumbhakarṇenivə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">sākṣāt kāla mahāsamādhi maharəp ri syūhaniṅ rāt kabeh.</l>
265</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.24" n="24"><l n="a">sakvehkveh para devasaṅgha maṅiriṅ hyaṅ brahma kepvan sira,</l>
.<l n="b">de hyaṅ dhātṛ ri kumbhakarṇa ya suṅən maṅke varānugraha. ’</l>
.<l n="c">āpan rakva mahātirodra ya, makin sor saṅ vatək devata;</l>
.<l n="d">deniṅ gə̄ṅ kalavan guṇa, syapatikaṅ devopamanyerika?’</l>
270 <!-- <app>(a) C sakveh niṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.02.25" n="25"><l n="a">nā tojar para deva, tan kagamanan de hyaṅ jagatkāraṇa;</l>
.<l n="b">tan saṅ hyaṅ karaṇanya rakva təkaniṅ vīryālpaniṅ janmavān;</l>
.<l n="c">tan len karmaphalanya rakva magave sihniṅ bhaṭāreri ya.</l>
275<l n="d">yekā hetuniran təkānurun, ike saṅ kumbhakarṇenasə̄.</l>
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="2" met="upajāti" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03">
.<!--Upajāti: = - ~ | - - ~| ~ - ~ | - =-->
280<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.01" n="1"><l n="a">səḍəṅnikaṅ deva vimohitāśā</l>
. <l n="b">de hyaṅ jagatkāraṇa makral ambək,</l>
. <l n="c">sarasvatī rakva sireka vaktan,</l>
. <l n="d">strī hyaṅ vidhi prajña mahāviveka.</l>
.</lg>
285<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.02" n="2"><l n="a">nda śīghragāmy oṣadhi saṅ vatək hyaṅ</l>
.<l n="b">muṅgv iṅ liḍahniṅ varakumbhakarṇa;</l>
.<l n="c">sirāgave vākyanikaṅ virodha</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ seṣṭiniṅ tvas tinañan bhaṭāra.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) z tinahan.</app> -->
290</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.03" n="3"><l n="a">’prasuptasuptā juga,’ liṅnya rakva,</l>
.<l n="b">’mevvīvu varṣanya taman pavuṅva.’</l>
.<l n="c">inastvakən saṅ hyaṅ ike vuvusnya,</l>
.<l n="d">suptā sadā tan hana topamanya.</l>
295</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.04" n="4"><l n="a">samantarā teki bhaṭāra luṅha</l>
.<l n="b">sūkṣmoməsat mvaṅ para deva tuṣṭa.</l>
.<l n="c">sarasvatī rakva siran huvus mūr</l>
.<l n="d">saṅke tutukniṅ varakumbhakarṇa.</l>
300</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.05" n="5"><l n="a">kunaṅ tikaṅ rākṣasa kumbhakarṇa,</l>
.<l n="b">gə̄ṅ mona monək ta ya kāri śoka,</l>
.<l n="c">təkapni śabdanya dudū pininta,</l>
.<l n="d">bhinneki lāvan kaka len arinya.</l>
305 <!-- <app>(c) y nādanya.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.06" n="6"><l n="a">na hetukanyāturu tan pakāla,</l>
.<l n="b">tan vruh ri polah daśavaktrarāja</l>
.<l n="c">mahābala krūra jagatpramāṇa</l>
310<l n="d">trailokya cūrṇan buburən katə̄nya.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) BFz hetunyā-.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.07" n="7"><l n="a">apan tayaṅ deva bhaṭāra denya,</l>
.<l n="b">salvirnikaṅ janma janādi bhasman,</l>
315<l n="c">gupay tumuṅkul ri padadvayanya,</l>
.<l n="d">deniṅ varānugraha hetu dibya.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) Fy tayā.</app> -->
.</lg>
.
320<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.03.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">ikaṅ kaḍatvan maṅaran ri ləṅkā,</l>
.<l n="b">parnahni rākanya ya tenalapnya;</l>
.<l n="c">dhaneśvarāləs matilar kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkā saṅ daśāsyan sumilih ri ləṅkā.</l>
325 <!-- <app>(c) E2 -āṅləs.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
.
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="3" met="kilayu manəḍəṅ" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04">
330<!--Kilayu manədəṅ: - - ~ | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">lvir meru sakala haləpiṅ kaḍatvan, atibhīṣaṇa kagirigiri;</l>
.<l n="b">līlāvəlar i pucakikaṅ gunuṅ trikuṭa, ratna kanaka vinaṅun;</l>
.<l n="c">lvahnyādaləm aṅidəri kaṇṭaniṅ pura, baṅun tasik aṅalunalun;</l>
335<l n="d">paṇḍanya mamijah, aṅuḍoḍa ketakanikeṅ paras asəmu paraṅ.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) kaṇṭa- &lt; kaṇṭha-, Ed.
. (d) y karaṅ.</app> -->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.02" n="2"><l n="a">baprordha vatu hitəmikendranīla navaratna ya pinatikakən;</l>
340<l n="b">dvāranya catur, asəmu parvatāgni, bata kāñcana hinasabakən;</l>
.<l n="c">tuṇḍā saṅa susumika riṅ sagopura sagopura, təlas inukir;</l>
.<l n="d">lvir mṛtyu sakala mapupul pucaknya murub iṅ vihat aṅarabarab.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) kāñcana &lt; kañcana, Ed.
. (d) A sakala sakala; qz viyat.</app> -->
345 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.03" n="3"><l n="a">malvārata ri harəpikā vaṅuntur atiśobha, samara sakala;</l>
.<l n="b">nyāsāgəṅ adava təpiniṅ pəkən, pahəman iṅ balagaṇa sahana.</l>
.<l n="c">nkāne daləmika makin adbhutā, yaśa panaṅkilan ika madədə̄;</l>
.<l n="d">bvat mantən ika hana mineru, muṅgv i təṅahiṅ vataṅan aṅililan;</l>
350</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.04" n="4"><l n="a">lvir megha mahirəṅ i həduknya, gumyar ataṭit maṇi pinucakakən;</l>
.<l n="b">sə̄k deniṅ asurabala vīrayodha, hana taṇḍa subala pamukha;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ taṅ pagajahan aruhur vaṅunya juga, len paturagan apəḍək;</l>
.<l n="d">hrikniṅ gaja turaga baṅun hanāṅduka silih pupuh arurək arok.</l>
355 <!-- <app>(d) A hanāduka.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.05" n="5"><l n="a">maṅkin ləyəp anupama tiṅkahiṅ pura, ləvəs haləpika ri daləm,</l>
.<l n="b">deniṅ sphaṭikagṛha suteja bhāsvara; hanan kadi rahina sadā,</l>
.<l n="c">sākṣāt smarabhavana təkāṅalih ri* tayaniṅ smara maṅavaṅavaṅ,</l>
360<l n="d">mvaṅ taṅ hana kadi śivaveśma rakva kahanan daśamukha maguliṅ.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) C amanuṣa; (c) y aṅaliyani. </app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.06" n="6"><l n="a">śobhārsik i natarika, padmarāga ya hənīnya, rinəmuk akila;</l>
.<l n="b">vaiḍūrya maṇik asəmu vintaṅ arja pariginya, mamaḍaṅi ləmah;</l>
365<l n="c">kapvāvulan i buṅah i vaktraniṅ stry anupame daləm ika kuməñar,</l>
.<l n="d">lvir byoma mapalih i surup hyaṅ arka ri səḍəṅnyan anuḍuh i tavaṅ.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) manuduhi &lt; anuḍuhi ?</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.07" n="7"><l n="a">sə̄k sarvakusuma, manəḍəṅ mapādapa, hanāsəkar asirasiran;</l>
370<l n="b">citropama: yadi suməkar, məkar; kumuḍu rakva, kumuḍu satata;</l>
.<l n="c">riṅ tāman atiki juga maṅkanaṅ kusuma tan ləsəh, amahi laṅə̄;</l>
.<l n="d">mandaṅ ravi ri təkanikerikātis, arəs iṅ daśamukha subala.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.08" n="8"><l n="a">vvai śuddha ri hiriṅi vukirnya rakva, səkar aṅjrah aṅidəri təpi,</l>
375<l n="b">mumbul saka ri tutukikaṅ gajendramukhavimban inukir abutəṅ;</l>
.<l n="c">hə̄bniṅ taru varasurapārijāta kahananya, kadi maṅuliṅa,</l>
.<l n="d">krūrādbhuta kadi gaṇadeva rakva maharəp luməbura bhuvana.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) ABCqv -vimba hinukir; (c) v ta hananya; BF mamuliṅa.</app> -->
.</lg>
380<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.09" n="9"><l n="a">tūsanya tuməḍun irikaṅ lvah ardha midər iṅ pura, təka ri daləm,</l>
.<l n="b">len taṅ tuməḍun ika ri veśmaniṅ kakakakeña, mamahi kalaṅə̄n;</l>
.<l n="c">lvir mandara ri təṅahiṅ abdhi taṅ pura, laṅə̄nyan asəmu siluman;</l>
.<l n="d">gəntərnya paṅucapikanaṅ mahāsura hanan kadi matəmaha rəm.</l>
.</lg>
385<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.10" n="10"><l n="a">āpan yan ucapən i kalaṅvaniṅ pura baṅun paśupatinagara;</l>
.<l n="b">līlāṅuṅaṅ i sahananiṅ digantara təkeṅ giri jaladhi vana;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ taṅ sahanahananikaṅ balālaya kabeh paḍa ta kavulatan,</l>
.<l n="d">lvir svarga kavava, baṅun indrarājya baruṇālayan inaṅəṅaṅən.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) ta &lt; tan (m.c.)</app> -->
390</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.04.11" n="11"><l n="a">ṅkā kottara puranikanaṅ vibhīṣaṇa sake daśamukhanagara;</l>
.<l n="b">lvir viṣṇubhavana, kuməñar maṇiknya kadi kostubha suməṅ i tavaṅ.</l>
.<l n="c">riṅ dakṣiṇa hana kadi dhātraveśma, kadi parvata kanaka murub;</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkānah saṅ asura varakumbhakarṇa maturū, turuṅ ika mavuṅu.</l>
395</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="4" met="sragdharā" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05">
.<!--Sragdharā: - - - | - ~ - | - ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | ~ - - | ~ - - | ~ - =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.01" n="1"><l n="a">tan ṅeh yan varṇanən kābhinavani haləpin rājya ləṅkātiśobha;</l>
400 <l n="b">varṇan śrī rākṣasendrāṅaṅənaṅən i vəkasniṅ mahāsakti riṅ rāt;</l>
. <l n="c">ṅhiṅ tekaṅ bhūr bhuvah svah paravaśanən, ikaṅ nāga mānuṣya bhasman.</l>
. <l n="d">mvaṅ tekaṅ deva muṅgv iṅ laṅit alahakənā, cihnaniṅ digjayeṅ praṅ.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) Aqz tāṅeh.</app> -->
.</lg>
405<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.02" n="2"><l n="a">maṅkā de saṅ daśāsyādbhuta dadin umijil saṅka riṅ jro kaḍatvan,</l>
.<l n="b">kapvānohaṅ vatək rākṣasa, majara sireṅ vīra sāmanta yodha;</l>
.<l n="c">sampun śīghra pratiṣṭheṅ kanakamaṇipalaṅke ruhur maṇḍapāgə̄ṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ taṅ vastrārja siṅhāsana saha suragānindya sampun sənaddha.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) Aq ri; (b) A majari.
410 (d) siṅhāsana saha (OJED, s.v. siṅhāsana) &lt; siṅhāsana Ed.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.03" n="3"><l n="a">sakvehkvehniṅ vatək rākṣasa humaḍəp i sor, iṅ ləmah, tan hanāṅsal;</l>
.<l n="b">kīrṇekaṅ vil paḍāhyāsirasiran arivəg len ikaṅ bhūtasena;</l>
.<l n="c">mukhyaṅ mantrī prahastādhika sira pinatih denikaṅ yakṣa rodra,</l>
415<l n="d">yekan muṅgv iṅ harəp saṅ daśamukhan umarək riṅ batur krūrarūpa.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) ABqv batu.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.04" n="4"><l n="a">tatkālaṅ rākṣasābyūṅan apupul, arupək lvirnikaṅ rājya malvā,</l>
.<l n="b">deniṅ vīrādbhutākveh śatayuta maməpək syuh pənuh taṅ paṅastryan.</l>
420<l n="c">ndah prāptaṅ dūta saṅke dhanapati maṅaran gomukhaṅ yakṣarūpa;</l>
.<l n="d">yekāvvat rekha, yekan vinacakən i siraṅ rāvaṇāṅrəṅva donya.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) Aqv saṅkeṅ.
. (a) arupək &lt; arupə̄k Ed.</app> -->
.</lg>
425<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.05" n="5"><l n="a">’hā hā he saṅ daśāsyaprabhu, kita pinakottuṅga niṅ rājya ləṅkā,</l>
.<l n="b">saṅ sākṣāt brahmarūpeṅ bhuvana, katakut iṅ sarvadevāprameya.</l>
.<l n="c">heman śaktinta, heman, yayi, guṇani bapaṅkun kṛtānugraheṅ hyaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">yan tan vvantən kṣamānteṅ para, mavəlasa riṅ kāsyasih bhagnavīrya.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) y rari.</app> -->
430</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.06" n="6"><l n="a">āpan doniṅ guṇānindya humilaṅakəna kleśaniṅ sarvabhūmi,</l>
.<l n="b">doniṅ rājāsiheṅ paṇḍita, mulahakənaṅ devabhakty ānivārya.</l>
.<l n="c">tan maṅkāmbəkta, maṅkin haruhara kətikaṅ svarga len bhikṣuveśma;</l>
.<l n="d">pamyaktan ṅvaṅ pinuccanta, milag aku saka ṅke təkaptātiduṣṭa.</l>
435 <!-- <app>(a) C humilaṅakəni; (d) y ṅkā.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.07" n="7"><l n="a">saṅsiptan, hayva maṅkāṅ ulaha, təlasanaṅ buddhi mūrkhāvamāna;</l>
.<l n="b">prih taṅ dharmānurāgeṅ bhuvana ya phalaniṅ bhūpatī martyaloka.</l>
.<l n="c">rākantekopamantā: satata mulahakən dharma dharmeṣṭha riṅ rāt;</l>
440<l n="d">rəp, śīghran sih bhaṭāreśvara sira kahiḍəp mitra vandhuṅku maṅke.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) ABCqv təlasanābuddhi-.
. (a) maṅkāṅ &lt; maṅkaṅ Ed.
. (c) dharmeṣṭha &lt; dharmeṣṭa Ed.</app> -->
. </lg>
445<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.08" n="8"><l n="a">yekānuṅ polahantātutura ri sutaniṅ brahmavaṅśānivārya;</l>
.<l n="b">ndā tan tūteṅ mahārākṣasa, matəguha riṅ buddhi kāruṇyacitta.</l>
.<l n="c">paṅgil tāntənku, bhāgyanta katəkan apupul mvaṅ vatək devasaṅgha,</l>
.<l n="d">sakvan selvāna ta ṅvaṅ titir umarək i jə̄ṅ śrī mahānīlakaṇṭha.’</l>
.</lg>
450<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.09" n="9"><l n="a">nā liṅ saṅ rāka muṅgv iṅ tulisira; kumətər toṣṭha saṅ rāvaṇojar:</l>
.<l n="b">’dhik hāh, tucchādhamekaṅ dhanapati, cumalaṅ rākṣasa krūra duṣṭa;</l>
.<l n="c">duṣṭanyan tan katon, ṅūnin arəp aṅətətekiṅ kaḍatvan ri ləṅkā;</l>
.<l n="d">āpan rājyaṅku saṅkeṅ ibu juga karaṇaṅkun valat tan tahən tvas.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) y karma; (c) F aṅhətekiṅ.
455 (a) toṣṭha &lt; toṣṭa
. (d) karaṇaṅkun &lt; karaṇaṅku (m.c.)</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.10" n="10"><l n="a">maṅke yākon samitraṅ hulunika kalavan deva gandharvarāja!</l>
.<l n="b">dūraṅ pakṣīndra saumyātut adulura lavan nāgarājātirodra.</l>
460<l n="c">təkvan maṅgəh musuh rakva kaliliran ikaṅ deva viṣṇv ātiduṣṭa.</l>
.<l n="d">ndi ṅvaṅ yan mitraṅ artheśvara maliha kənohnyan mahādivya riṅ rāt?</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) C iki.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.11" n="11"><l n="a">mohanyāmbək tayaṅ śāsana, karaṇanikan siṅhit iṅ śatru mūrkha.</l>
465<l n="b">lvāmbək, noraṅ kayogyan ruhunakəna təkapkv amrəpeṅ svargaloka;</l>
.<l n="c">yadyan sakvehnikaṅ deva tumuluṅa kabeh, sesiniṅ svarga mətva,</l>
.<l n="d">saṅtabya ṅvaṅ, bhaṭāreśvara sira śaraṇanyaṅ musuh, tar kavədya.’</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y śakti.
. (a) mūrkha &lt; murkha</app> -->
470</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.12" n="12"><l n="a">nojar saṅ rākṣasendrāṅumanuman i siraṅ lokapālātighora.</l>
.<l n="b">ndah śīghraṅ candrahāsenayatakən irikaṅ dūtakaṇṭhan katiṅhas;</l>
.<l n="c">mumbul taṅ rah, maṅuṅgul śirahikan uməsat riṅ laṅit rāhutulya.</l>
.<l n="d">’hā hā ho, dūta təmbe guməsəṅana kaḍatvanmu, koṅ yakṣarāja.’</l>
475 <!-- <app>(c) F maṅundul; A ravu.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.13" n="13"><l n="a">maṅkin sakrodha saṅ rāvaṇa ri gatinikānāpathany aṅkasaṅkas;</l>
.<l n="b">ṅkā tekaṅ bhūta sinvīn amaṅana ri tibānyan təkeṅ aṅga bhakṣyan.</l>
.<l n="c">ndah sampun śīghra mantuk sira madana manukvaṅ dhanendrādhirāja.</l>
480<l n="d">’yekan syūhən.’ kətojarnira mucapirikaṅ bhṛtya sāmanta vīra.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) F manukvā. </app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.14" n="14"><l n="a">sakvehkvehniṅ vatək rākṣasa gumuruh avū, maṅrəṅə̄ vṛtta hetu,</l>
.<l n="b">an saṅ śrī rākṣasendrāṅlurugana ri siraṅ rāka, maṅdona maṅke.</l>
485<l n="c">hetunyan gadgadādan gaja turaga rathāpaṅlagā cāpa bajra,</l>
.<l n="d">ghūrṇaṅ goṅ bheri ginval tabətabəhan umuṅ mvaṅ suraknyaṅ balāhya.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.15" n="15"><l n="a">lumrākveh riṅ pəkən tan papaligaran ikaṅ yodha mohāṅgakāra,</l>
.<l n="b">mvaṅ tekaṅ vṛddhamantrī paḍa huvus apajəg riṅ vaṅuntur tumaṅgə̄ṅ</l>
490<l n="c">rap rap rəp, śīghra məṇḍək makiḍupuh i vijil śrī mahāyakṣanātha,</l>
.<l n="d">sampun muṅgv iṅ rathābhrā sphaṭikagaṇa, susun sapta tuṇḍanya malvā.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) makiḍupuh i (OJED, s.v. məṇḍək) &lt; makiḍupuh</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.16" n="16"><l n="a">ṅkā saṅ śrī rākṣasendrādbhuta sira lumihat denikaṅ vīra rodra,</l>
495<l n="b">sākṣāt kālāpupul mṛtyu sakalan umurub tulyaniṅ śastradaṅṣṭrā.</l>
.<l n="c">’Endah koṅ lokapālāhuripa təkap ike! ndin parantoṅsirənmva?</l>
.<l n="d">yadyan prāpteṅ mahāsvarga sahana ya tutən, mon mureṅ viṣṇuloka.’</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) F lumiyat.</app> -->
.</lg>
500<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.05.17" n="17"><l n="a">maṅkā vāk citta saṅ rāvaṇa, vəkasan akon maṅkateṅ vīrasaṅgha.</l>
.<l n="b">tan dvāṅhrik taṅ gaja syandana, vahu lumurug taṅ mahāyakṣa rodra;</l>
.<l n="c">konta mvaṅ bajra cakrenayatakən, akətər buddhiniṅ rāt tumiṅhal;</l>
.<l n="d">len tekaṅ byomamārgāṅavaṅavaṅ asurak lvir gəlap sevulakṣa.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y maṅkā liṅ saṅ daśāsya ri vəkasan.</app> -->
505</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="5" met="basantatilakā" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06">
.<!--Vasantatilaka: - - ~ | - ~ ~ | ~ - ~ | ~ - ~ | - =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.01" n="1"><l n="a">dhūmrākṣa vīra makapaṅharəp iṅ lumampah,</l><l n="b">muṅgv iṅ rathāṅgamaṇi bhāsvara kātarā ya;</l><l n="c">morṇāsavit ya masəkartaji ratna muñcar,</l><l n="d">khaḍgāstra tīkṣṇa ginəgə̄nya sudīpta malvā.</l>
510</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.02" n="2"><l n="a">sə̄k taṅ balābalabalan dah anekavarṇa,</l>
.<l n="b">vvil bhūta yakṣa, hana dānava hañjahañja,</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ taṅ kavandha juga mūr rumuhun śirahnya,</l>
.<l n="d">mulyar matanya malələ̄ ri tutuk malābaṅ.</l>
515 <!-- <app>(a) y anekarūpa; (d) F maləlū.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.03" n="3"><l n="a">nkān bajramuṣṭi ri vurinya jayeṅ triloka,</l>
.<l n="b">airāvaṇopama gajahnika śuddhavarṇa,</l>
.<l n="c">dīptaṅ gaḍiṅ catur asə̄ṅ kadi mṛtyurūpa,</l>
520<l n="d">lvir nāga rodra tulalaynya maṅuṇḍa konta.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.04" n="4"><l n="a">krūrāṅadəg ta ya ri rəṅganikaṅ dvipāṅga,</l>
.<l n="b">cakre təṅənya pinutər kadi sūryavimba;</l>
.<l n="c">akveh balanya maṅiriṅ paḍa rodrarodra,</l>
525<l n="d">svarga ndi tan hilaṅa denya yadin sakāmbah.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) A veda.</app> -->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.05" n="5"><l n="a">mvaṅ saṅ supārśva lumurug ratharatnasaṅgha,</l>
.<l n="b">lvir siṅha rodra mulat iṅ gaja matta garva;</l>
530<l n="c">śūlāstra yeka tinahən parameṅ kaśaktin,</l>
.<l n="d">tan pantarāmijilakən śarabahni muntab.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.06" n="6"><l n="a">sātus balanyaṅ agajah paḍa śīghraśīghra,</l>
.<l n="b">rvaṅ lakṣa saṅkhyanikaṅ akṣitigāmyavega;</l>
535<l n="c">guntur paḍanya sumaput kadi bāyubajra,</l>
.<l n="d">dhvastaṅ śilādri kaparah paḍa bhasmibhūta.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) A dhvastā.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.07" n="7"><l n="a">śīghrāṅ akampana haneṅ turagātidibya;</l>
540<l n="b">cət, byomamārga juga, cət, mahavan ləmah ya;</l>
.<l n="c">sūkṣmātisūkṣma, vəkasan maśarīra vāhya,</l>
.<l n="d">lagy ātilar kuda, haneṅ gaja indra tulya.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) śīghrāṅ &lt; śīghraṅ</app> -->
.</lg>
545<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.08" n="8"><l n="a">vadvanya rākṣasa baṅun varakinnarendra,</l>
.<l n="b">len taṅ dəliṅdəliṅ avarṇa surāpsarāhyā,</l>
.<l n="c">bhedanya daṅṣṭranika moga miṅis karəsrəs,</l>
.<l n="d">socāvəlū suməṅ abaṅ kadi padma rakta.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y kirṇa rodra; (d) A luməṅ.</app> -->
550 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.09" n="9"><l n="a">ghora prakopa lumurug kadi kālarūpa,</l>
.<l n="b">lvir parvatāgni dumilah təkapiṅ subhūṣā;</l>
.<l n="c">ṅak ṅak, savitnyan uragādhipa divyaśakti,</l>
.<l n="d">daṅṣṭromurub mabaruṅan lavan astra tīkṣṇa.</l>
555 <!-- <app>(a) C ghora ṅ; (b) F subhūṣaṇa.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.06.10" n="10"><l n="a">hastīndra śuddha* magalak pakavāhanāṅhrik,</l>
.<l n="b">sy āmogha tan sah i təṅənyan inuṇḍa koṇḍa;</l>
.<l n="c">ghūrṇaṅ gəlap mavurahan makapaṅharəpnya,</l>
560<l n="d">rvaṅ koṭilakṣa bala vīra ri vuntat ahyā.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) C kuddha; (d) y agya.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="6" met="suvadanā" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07">
565<!--Suvadanā: - - - | - ~ - | - ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | ~ - - | - ~ ~ | ~ =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.01" n="1"><l n="a">ry aṅkat saṅ rāvaṇātyadbhuta, laku panutubniṅ rākṣasabala;</l><l n="b">sampun pūrṇa pratiṣṭheṅ ratha kuda mahulu rvā hastivadana,</l><l n="c">sākṣāt hyaṅ kālarudrāharəp i hilaṅaniṅ trailokya ləburən,</l><l n="d">muntab taṅ bahni saṅke mata, latulatuniṅ krodhāmurupuhi.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y maṅkat; A manutub; (b) y madulur; (d) AB saṅkeṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.02" n="2"><l n="a">vṛndavṛndevu taṅ rākṣasapati maṅiriṅ muṅgv iṅ vurinira,</l>
570<l n="b">mukhyaṅ mantrī prahastādhika huvus asikəp gāṇḍeva pinəniṅ,</l>
.<l n="c">krūraṅ hasty āruhur rākṣasamukha, masalit daṅṣṭrānya lumarap;</l>
.<l n="d">kumlab taṅ ketu raktāṅaladalad umurub kady āmaṅana rāt.</l>
. <!-- <app>This stanza is missing in F.</app> -->
. </lg>
575<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.03" n="3"><l n="a">guntur mumbul, gunuṅ rug, vukir alas aṅalih, lvīr umbak aṅasut</l>
.<l n="b">tiṅkahniṅ rākṣasātyadbhuta bala savatək ləṅkendra lumurug;</l>
.<l n="c">ndā tan varṇan; təke jə̄ṅniṅ acala maṅaran kailāśaṅ asura,</l>
.<l n="d">lumrākveh riṅ təgal rakva maṅibəki səsə̄k prāpteṅ girivana.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) v vukir alas: saha vukir; CF lvir rumbak.</app> -->
580</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.04" n="4"><l n="a">kagyatgyat durbalaṅ rākṣasa təpinikanaṅ kailāśa malayū,</l>
.<l n="b">muṅsī jə̄ṅ lokapālāpura, paḍa kumətər deniṅ ripu təka;</l>
.<l n="c">tovin ’taṅ dūta sampun pəjah ika ya təkap yakṣendra mabutəṅ,’</l>
.<l n="d">maṅkā liṅnyān kabeh rakva humatur i sirāryārtheśvarasura.</l>
585 <!-- <app>(a) təpinikanaṅ &lt; təpinikaṅ, em., m.c.
. (d) y sira śry Artheśvara.</app> -->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.05" n="5"><l n="a">ndan saṅ hyaṅ lokapālāṅaṅənaṅən i rusitniṅ lampah inivə̄:</l>
.<l n="b">āpan sih hetuniṅ maṅkana, tuhutuhuniṅ vvaṅ sānak atuha;</l>
590<l n="c">maṅken mundur maveh pāpa ya, baṅun atuluṅ śvānānəmu lara;</l>
.<l n="d">nirbhagnaṅ śabda yukty āparimita ri kədə̄nyan moha kuhaka.</l>
. <!--<app>(c) Bz maṇke mundur.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.06" n="6"><l n="a">siṅgih yan sattva muṅgv iṅ vana, riṅ apa sukhanyan vehana dhana?</l>
595<l n="b">deniṅ vvadniṅ tṛṇa mvaṅ halalaṅ ika bhinukty ānuṣṭani manah.</l>
.<l n="c">lāvan vre, dūra tuṣṭanya suṅana kanaka mvaṅ bhūṣaṇa maṇi,</l>
.<l n="d">tvas kabvaṅ denikaṅ vṛkṣaphala sakahiḍəp mūlyottama təmən.</l>
. <!--<app>(c) Cy -manik; (d) z dhvas; v tabvaṅ.</app>-->
. </lg>
600<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.07" n="7"><l n="a">milv ekiṅ sūkarāmbək, riṅ apa harəpa riṅ sarvāvaṅivaṅi?</l>
.<l n="b">ṅhiṅ durgandhābv apaṅkācəmər ika kaharəpnyāturva kinuśa.</l>
.<l n="c">maṅkāmbək saṅ daśāsyāpraṅa juga kaharəpnyan duṣṭa satata,</l>
.<l n="d">melik riṅ dharma, sotniṅ danujakula sakebunyan paṅapuyi.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) y maṅkvekiṅ.</app>-->
605 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.08" n="8"><l n="a">nā hetu śrī dhanendrāṅutus i sahananiṅ vīran pamapaga:</l>
.<l n="b">yogandhī viṣṇu maṅgəh balanira pinakāgrabhṛtya suyaśa,</l>
.<l n="c">padma mvaṅ śaṅkha duśśāsana kaluṣasadā durkāla kubala</l>
.<l n="d">cakrāsya krodha bajrāgada paraśu balābālānala hana.</l>
610 <!--<app>(c) F Duśāśada; (d) v -alahana: -asahana. </app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.09" n="9"><l n="a">sampun śīghrāpupul riṅ ləbuh ika, suməgut pvekaṅ balagaṇa;</l>
.<l n="b">saṅkhyāsaṅkhyaṅ vatək rākṣasa, paḍa masikəp sarvāstra niśita;</l>
.<l n="c">ghoraṅ yakṣāṅuhuh, mvaṅ tabətabəhan umuṅ goṅ bheri maṅavur;</l>
615<l n="d">tan dvātaṅkəp tikaṅ praṅ, daśamukha ya huvus prāpteṅ pəkən agə̄ṅ.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) v tekaṅ, y tikaṅ; (c) F aṅuvuh.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.10" n="10"><l n="a">gutgūtən taṅ vatək vīragaṇa paḍa masə̄ krūrāṅamahamah;</l>
.<l n="b">kapvātəmpuh masuṅgut, paḍa danuja, jəmur rodrākrak aṅuhuh;</l>
620<l n="c">len taṅ dhīrāṅamuk riṅ gaja ratha, mamanah maṅduk ya manulup;</l>
.<l n="d">dudvekaṅ yakṣa rodrāṅlayaṅ ika ya baṅun pakṣīndra mataruṅ.</l>
. <!--<app>(b) v kapvānəmpuh səṅgut; C jamur.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.11" n="11"><l n="a">prodbhūtaṅ praṅ; baṅun syūhaṅ acala, kumədut pvekaṅ kṣititala,</l>
625<l n="b">deniṅ vīrātirodreṅ guṇa paḍa paramāsaṅkhyāparimita;</l>
.<l n="c">yekāvantah silih rok, paḍa mamijilakən yakṣāsuragaṇa</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ taṅ sarvāstra saṅkeṅ tutukika kumutug lvīr untabiṅ apuy.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) z tekaṅ; (b) z paramaśaktyā-; d) A saṅke; C rantab, F runtab.</app>-->
. </lg>
630<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.12" n="12"><l n="a">hetunyālvaṅ mahābhīṣaṇa matumaṅ ikaṅ vaṅkay kadi gunuṅ;</l>
.<l n="b">bar pət, dhvastaṅ ləbū mlək, ḍəḍət ika təkapiṅ rah lvir ryak anaput.</l>
.<l n="c">maṅkin saṅ vīra rodrāmrih ayaśa, maṅamuk riṅ parvata śava;</l>
.<l n="d">biṅkas rvaṅ koṭilakṣaṅ balagaṇa savatək yakṣendra malayū.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) A -āṅlvaṅ, q amvaṅ; (d) Aqz lakṣā.</app>-->
635 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.13" n="13"><l n="a">ndah śīghraṅ bajramuṣṭy āṅuliṅakən i gajahnyan rodra mapulih;</l>
.<l n="b">dhūmrākṣākampana mvaṅ vikaṭa saha balomaṅsə̄ tan akaḍat;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ sakvehniṅ mahāyakṣapati parəṅ amūk maṅduk maṅucupi,</l>
.<l n="d">hetunyan durbalaṅ vaiśravaṇabala larut syuh tan paṅavəran.</l>
640 <!--<app>(b) Fv balāmaṅsə̄; (c) A -yakṣamati; z paḍa mamuk; (d) ACqz pahavəran</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.14" n="14"><l n="a">lāvan saṅ rāvaṇa krūra tumuluy asikəp daṇḍāstra, tuməḍun</l>
.<l n="b">saṅkeṅ siṅhāsanasyandana sira, mamupuh śatrv āyuta pəjah;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ taṅ suptāghna vīrottama parəṅ umasə̄ saṅkeṅ panaliṅa,</l>
645<l n="d">vaktrāsyāṅlah saha bhṛtyagaṇa bala pənuh sampun kapugutan.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.15" n="15"><l n="a">rūg bəntar taṅ vatək vaiśravaṇa sinusunan divyāstran inirup</l>
.<l n="b">de saṅ vīra prahastānala pavana virūpākṣan pamanasi.</l>
.<l n="c">krodhekaṅ viṣṇu sīghrāṅabənakən i gadānyānimbat aṅusī,</l>
650<l n="d">mvaṅ yogandhī prakopāṅhalahala ruməmuk ləṅkādhipabala.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) v Besravaṇa; (b) v mamanasi.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.16" n="16"><l n="a">dhīrāmbəkniṅ vatək rāvaṇa mihat i pamuknyaṅ rvādbhuta masə̄,</l>
.<l n="b">endah lvir kāla kəmbar, rinəbut ika makin sahyākrak amupuh;</l>
655<l n="c">mārīcāsyandana syuh təkap ika kasavat, mvaṅ taṅ kuda rəñuh,</l>
.<l n="d">mārīcāləs matiṅgal ratha, dadin umasə̄ dhūmrākṣa mamanah.</l>
.<!--<app> (c) C Mārīca syuh rathanya təkap-; (d) C -āṅləs.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.17" n="17"><l n="a">tan dvan trus pyahnikaṅ viṣṇu, gumulak umucur rahnyādaravayan;</l>
660<l n="b">yogandhī krodha, yekan vinuk ika ya təkap suptāghna ya pəjah;</l>
.<l n="c">maṅkin ghūrṇaṅ vatək vaiśravaṇa silih idək glānāmrih alayu,</l>
.<l n="d">ginrək ginlis minohan, paḍa mati ri harəpniṅ rājya matumaṅ.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) q gumuliṅ kumuḍur; (b) v dinuk. </app>-->
.</lg>
665<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.18" n="18"><l n="a">ndah śīghraṅ rāvaṇāhyādbhuta vavaṅ amanek baprordha ri yava.</l>
.<l n="b">mvaṅ taṅ yakṣākəmit dvāra pinəjahaniran sampun kapugutan;</l>
.<l n="c">mə̄r ṅkāne gopura, ndah dinədəlira rubuh, bhraṣṭaṅ karubuhan;</l>
.<l n="d">makrak sakvehnya ghūrṇāsurakirika təkeṅ antahpura humuṅ.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) Fz Rāvaṇātyadbhuta; z umanek; (b) F pinəkan; (c) y maṇkāne; (d) z ghūrṇāvurahan ika. </app>-->
670</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.07.19" n="19"><l n="a">təkvan taṅ bahni mumbul saka ri taṅaniraṅ yakṣendra maṅasut;</l>
.<l n="b">yekāṅdagdhe pura, syuh gəsəṅikan umurub prāpteṅ alunalun;</l>
.<l n="c">lāvan tekaṅ vatək rākṣasa paḍa gumuruh rodran paṅidəri</l>
.<l n="d">saṅkeṅ pūrvottareṅ dakṣiṇa paḍa tumahap len paścima təka.</l>
675<!--<app> (a) A taṅan ikaṅ; (b) A -āṅdagdheṅ; y guməsəṅ ika murub; (d) BEF saṅke; BF purvottare.</app>-->
. </lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="7" met="śārdūlavikrīḍita" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08">
.<!--Śārdūlavikrīḍita: - - - | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | - - ~ | - - ~ | =-->
680<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.01" n="1"><l n="a">saṅ hyaṅ vaiśravaṇeki rakva caritan muṅgv iṅ daləmniṅ kuṭa;</l><l n="b">āścaryan lumihat sire təkanikaṅ dhairyāṅaran rāvaṇa;</l><l n="c">ṅūnin rakva siran harəp mijila, kevran denikaṅ puṣpaka</l><l n="d">prāpteṅ svargan umilyakən sahananiṅ strīratna, maṅken ḍatəṅ.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) y viryāṅaran; (c) y kepvan; (d) v maṅke ḍataṅ.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.02" n="2"><l n="a">yekā hetunirātirodra, sumaput taṅ krodha tan pāntara,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅkāne pṛṣṭhanikaṅ vimāna masikəp laṅkap mahābhīṣaṇa,</l>
685<l n="c">mvaṅ sarva sphaṭikottameki pakabhūṣārja pradīptojvala,</l>
.<l n="d">lvir saṅ hyaṅ harimūrti rakva mahavan pakṣīndra rotāṅlayaṅ.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) y yekan; (c) F pakabhūṣaṇa.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.03" n="3"><l n="a">sə̄k tekaṅ bala rākṣasāṅiriṅ i jə̄ṅ śrī lokapālan mijil,</l>
690<l n="b">mvaṅ citrāyudha citracāpa surasenāgra pratiṣṭheṅ ratha;</l>
.<l n="c">ndan rakryan mapatih maṇīndra ri harəp muṅgv iṅ gajah yomasə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">rvaṅ lakṣaṅ bala vīrayodha maṅamuk, kāṅgək vatək rākṣasa.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) v pratiṣṭhe; (d) F lakṣā bala; y Rāvaṇa.</app>-->
. </lg>
695<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.04" n="4"><l n="a">lāvan taṅ varapāvakojvala murub riṅ rājya sampun marən,</l>
.<l n="b">de rakryan mapatih sireka mamanah riṅ varṣa tīrthottama;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ tekaṅ midər iṅ pureka ya huvus bhraṣṭaṅ mahārākṣasa,</l>
.<l n="d">de citrāyudha citracāpa mamanah saṅkeṅ vihat durbala.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) z mahapāvako-; y pəjah; (b) y tirthopama; (d) E2z viyat.</app>-->
700 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.05" n="5"><l n="a">nkan maṅsə̄ bala rāvaṇādbhuta mahākrodhan samāmuk marək,</l>
.<l n="b">malvaṅ sevu salakṣa, māti kapisan de saṅ maṇīndrāmanah.</l>
.<l n="c">nāhan hetunikaṅ pravīra maṅaran dhūmrākṣa śīghrāpulih;</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkā citrāyudha citracāpa kavənaṅ sampun dinaṇḍeṅ gadā.</l>
705<!--<app> (a) F makin krodha; (b) A tan malvaṅ sevu lakṣa; (c) C hetu nika; (d) y pəjah ginada.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.06" n="6"><l n="a">mvaṅ rakryan mapatih maṇīndra karuhun sampun pəjah riṅ raṇa,</l>
.<l n="b">de saṅ śāraṇa rakva teki kalavan saṅ tuṣṭa māmatyani;</l>
.<l n="c">hetunyaṅ dhanarājabhṛtya malayū jrih kumyus aṅləs larut,</l>
710<l n="d">lvaṅnyātiṇḍih aneka lakṣa niyutaṅ gandharva vidyādhara.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) y Rāvaṇa; z teki rakva; F duṣṭa.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.08.07" n="7"><l n="a">ṅhiṅ saṅ hyaṅ dhanarāja kāri ri təlasniṅ vīra mātīṅ raṇa,</l>
.<l n="b">muṅgv iṅ rəṅganikaṅ vimānan umasə̄ lvir mṛtyu sākṣāt murub.</l>
715<l n="c">mundur taṅ bala rākṣasa, pramukha saṅ vīra prahastomurud;</l>
.<l n="d">tan saṅkeṅ vədi rakva vijña tumahāmbək saṅ daśāsyeṅ kaka.</l>
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="8" met="sragdharā" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09">
720<!--Sragdharā: - - - | - ~ - | - ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | ~ - - | ~ - - | ~ - =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.01" n="1"><l n="a">grit, kumvaṅ syandanātyadbhuta rathanika saṅ rāvaṇānindyagāmi,</l><l n="b">cuṇḍuk saṅ hyaṅ dhanendrāmanah amahi śara prodbhutāṅəṭṭahāsa.</l><l n="c">rudrāstraṅ bāṇa bāṇottama linəpasakən mvaṅ vukir bahni muntab,</l><l n="d">syuh bhraṣṭaṅ bāṇa sakvehnya təka ya pinusus deniraṅ yakṣarāja.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.02" n="2"><l n="a">lāvan pakṣīndra pāśoraga pinanahakən cūrṇita mvaṅ gajendra;</l>
.<l n="b">len tekaṅ bhūtayakṣāsuraśaraṅ inidək bhasmi de saṅ daśāsya.</l>
725<l n="c">ṅhiṅ tekaṅ daṇḍa tapvan pinagutakənireṅ śatru śūrātirodra,</l>
.<l n="d">saṅke hyaṅ rudra ṅūnin phalanika kahiḍəp mitra vandhv ādhikeṅ rāt.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) v sāśoraga.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.03" n="3"><l n="a">hetu śrī lokapālādbhuta vavaṅ atilar syandanāsiṅhanāda.</l>
730<l n="b">’oyuh koṅ rākṣasādhah, gada tarima, tutənmun təkeṅ roravāṅga.’</l>
.<l n="c">liṅ saṅ hyaṅ lokapālānavat i mukhanikaṅ rāvaṇan vīra maṅgəh,</l>
.<l n="d">pok pok, timbul baṅun parvata vəsi pinupuh riṅ mahādaṇḍa raṅrə.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) q ko; v tā.</app>-->
. </lg>
735<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.04" n="4"><l n="a">krodhāmbək saṅ daśāsyāmaləs ika manavat riṅ gadādaṇḍadaṇḍan, </l>
.<l n="b">kapvātəmbuṅ, vidagdheṅ takis ika matakis vīra mohāṅgakāra;</l>
.<l n="c">prodbhūtārok silih-kol, kadi gəlap ataruṅ ghūrṇitaṅ śabda mahya;</l>
.<l n="d">rug tekaṅ vṛkṣa len gopura kahava rubuh syuh təkeṅ rājyaveśma.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) v vidagdhā; (c) C aṅrok; (d) y ruruh. </app>-->
740 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.05" n="5"><l n="a">sə̄k raṅkaṅ mās kabuñcaṅ paravaśan uməsat ratnasaṅghanya muñcar;</l>
.<l n="b">sol tekaṅ vṛkṣa, puṣpāluru kadi pinusus, pārijātanya səmpal;</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ tekaṅ strī daləm kapyuhan ika, manaṅis vusvusən glāna rūkṣa,</l>
.<l n="d">kabvaṅ kombul təkap saṅ rva marukət apupuh prāpta ri jro kaḍatvan.</l>
745 <!--<app>(b) v -āṅluru.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.06" n="6"><l n="a">dhīrāmrih cidra, pantəs midər akuliliṅan riṅ purānep silih-sep;</l>
.<l n="b">endah lvir nāga rodrāpəluk ika sama tan sor sireṅ śaktimanta;</l>
.<l n="c">tovin sarvāstra ghorālivər ikan umijil saṅka riṅ deha rodra,</l>
750<l n="d">mvaṅ tekaṅ bahni saṅke kivaniran umurub bāyusaṅhāra muntab.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) A purāmet; (d) z madrəs.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.07" n="7"><l n="a">durgrāhyaṅ sañjatāneka sahana ya pupug dhvas hilaṅ bhagnavīrya,</l>
.<l n="b">de saṅ hartheśvara mvaṅ daśamukha kavaluy kabvaṅ iṅ dūradeśa;</l>
755<l n="c">ṅhiṅ tekaṅ bhūmi kampācala makasulayah siṅ katūb bhasmibhūta,</l>
.<l n="d">burvan mvaṅ siṅha mavrəg, jalanidhi kakəbur, mīna ləmbora cūrṇa.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) z puput; (b) Av Dhāneśvara, qy Artheśvara; v puradeśa.
. (b) mvaṅ daśamukha &lt; mvaṅ saṅ daśamukha</app>-->
. </lg>
760<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.08" n="8"><l n="a">maṅkā lvirniṅ jagat kolahala kabarubuh deniraṅ rvātirodra.</l>
.<l n="b">ṅkā nīcāṅucca papraṅnira marukət arok, mə̄r tikaṅ svarga kāmbah;</l>
.<l n="c">syuh bhraṣṭaṅ deva kagyat salakibi kumətər muṅsir iṅ rudraloka,</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ tekaṅ strī sakendran paḍa maṅili mareṅ śūnyaveśmātidurga.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) v nikaṅ; (b) E2 mar, y dhvas; z təkeṅ; (c) y svarga.</app>-->
765 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.09" n="9"><l n="a">ndan saṅ hyaṅ śakra mojar sira mihat i siraṅ rāvaṇa mvaṅ dhanendra:</l>
.<l n="b">’ndātan gə̄ṅ krodha ri ṅke! tumuruna, palakun mapraṅeṅ* martyaloka!</l>
.<l n="c">āpan byaktekanaṅ svarga kahava, pira taṅ kārya len devatānya.’</l>
.<l n="d">nā hetu śrī dhanendrāṅalih ikan umareṅ parvata mvaṅ daśāsya.</l>
770 <!--<app>(a) v ndā; Dv miyat; v sireṅ; (b) C mapraṅe.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.10" n="10"><l n="a">guntur syuh taṅ mahāparvata kapalu*, rəmuk śaila kṛṣṇanya bəntar;</l>
.<l n="b">muntab taṅ bahni saṅke vatu makapələṭok, dhvas maraṅ* vṛkṣa dagdha.</l>
.<l n="c">meṅguṅ* saṅ hyaṅ mahāmeru, kavadal i təkap saṅ mahāśakti riṅ praṅ*;</l>
775<l n="d">kagyat taṅ satva muṅgv iṅ halas* ika, karuhun saṅ tapākrak katunvan.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) C kavalu; (b) z rika; A mareṅ, y tikaṅ; (c) v eṅguṅ; v rat; (d) Fv halas.
. (d) halas &lt; alas</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.11" n="11"><l n="a">ndan sakveh saṅ mahāpaṇḍita sahana sireṅ* pājaran devatādi,</l>
780<l n="b">kapvākon* mintar aṅlena samara, matakut syūhaniṅ parvatāṅga.</l>
.<l n="c">cob cob, śīghran təkeṅ sāgara sira marukət; durbalaṅ matsya cūrṇa,</l>
.<l n="d">joṅ pelaṅ tan dva biṅkas karəm ika, gumuruh baṇyaganyātighūrṇa*;</l>
. <!--<app>(a) v nikeṅ, y nireṅ; (b) Fq ṅkā pvākon; (d) F bāṇyabanyā-, v bānyātighurṇa katon.</app>-->
.</lg>
785<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.12" n="12"><l n="a">len tekaṅ lombalomban* pəsut ika ya pəjah mvaṅ mubul bākapənya,</l>
.<l n="b">deniṅ sarvāstra tan pāntara kadi kinəla vvaynikaṅ* sindhu tīkṣṇa.</l>
.<l n="c">rəp, śīghran prāpta san hyaṅ baruṇa sira makon mālihe* saṅ silih kol.</l>
.<l n="d">bək ghor, sampun təkeṅ bhūtala*, paḍa tuməḍun; ghūrṇitaṅ nāga kagyat;</l>
.<!--<app> (a) z lumba-lumba; (b) C vvay ikaṅ; (c) C māliheṅ; (d) y pātala.</app>-->
790 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.09.13" n="13"><l n="a">liṇḍū taṅ bhūmi katrag, kadi ta ya* bubulaṅ saptapātāla koṇḍa.</l>
.<l n="b">maṅhrik saṅ hyaṅ pṛthivy ākusa sira* manaṅis n ton ikaṅ sthāna bəntar*.</l>
.<l n="c">ṅkān maṅsul saṅ rva, boṅləs, sira muvah umareṅ rājya ṅūni n pataṅkəp,</l>
.<l n="d">paṅguh sakveh vatək rākṣasabala kavəṅan ton sirātyadbhuteṅ rat.</l>
795<!--<app> (a) z katrag kadi ta ya: kagyat təmahana; (b) A hika; v maṅka, y molah.</app>-->
. </lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="9" met="madhulenda" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.10">
.<!--Madhulenda: ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - -->
800<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.10.01" n="1"><l n="a">səḍəṅnira silih pupuh silih arug* pragalbha masuve sirāpraṅ arukət,</l><l n="b">nda tan hana kacidra rakva, paḍa śakti lāghava mahāprabhāva riṅ ayun,</l><l n="c">rika prabhu daśāsya śīghran uməsat mareṅ gagana mukṣa tan patuduhan,</l><l n="d">pətəṅ ḍəḍət ikaṅ svarājya sumaput təkapnira lavan prahāra kumusuh.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) F paḍāsilih pupuh arug.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.10.02" n="2"><l n="a">gəyuh manah i saṅ dhanendra vulaṅun, hilaṅ tuturireṅ caturdik umuṅən*;</l>
.<l n="b">təkapnya riṅ apeki rakva mihateṅ* musuhnira, mahātidūraṅ usirən;</l>
805<l n="c">dhvaninya juga ghūrṇiteki* karəṅə̄ haneṅ* ruhurirātighora gumuruh,</l>
.<l n="d">baṅun gəlap anon mahākujana duṣṭa pāpa səḍəṅ iṅ hudan makəcəhan.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) y guməsəṅ; (b) F mihate; (c) F ghūrṇateki; Ev hane.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.10.03" n="3"><l n="a">nda tan dva təka saṅ daśāsya sumavat sakeṅ viyat i saṅ kakāṅhalahala;</l>
810<l n="b">gəlāna sira saṅ kakālara sireki tan vruh i ḍatəṅ saṅ antən amupuh.</l>
.<l n="c">ya hetunira yan kajuṅkəl irikaṅ mahītala, muvah dinaṇḍa tinitir</l>
.<l n="d">təkapnira daśāsya, sampay aṅuləṅ gəluṅnira sahojar asru suməgut*:</l>
.<!--<app> (d) F suməḍut.</app>-->
. </lg>
815</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="10" met="basantatilakā" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11">
.<!--Vasantatilaka: - - ~ | - ~ ~ | ~ - ~ | ~ - ~ | - =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.01" n="1"><l n="a">’dhik hāh ta koṅ asu dhaneśvara deva pāpa;</l><l n="b">bhoh, bhukti yeku təmahiṅ paraninda riṅ rāt,</l><l n="c">gə̄ṅ bhakti riṅ sura, sadālpa rikeṅ suyakṣa,</l><l n="d">kədv āharəp malap ikaṅ kaḍaton ri* ləṅkā.</l>
.<!--<app> (d) z malapa ta nagara ri.</app>-->
820 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.02" n="2"><l n="a">hāh dhik*, vəkasmu tikihən* makabuddhi dharma,</l>
.<l n="b">darpācihāciha mamitra bhaṭāra rudra.</l>
.<l n="c">toh vətvakən guṇamu, yan hana sih bhaṭāra,</l>
.<l n="d">maṅgəh ṅhulun luməburāmriha sāmbəkamva.’</l>
825<!--<app> (a) F dhik hah; v tikakaṅ, y kətikaṅ.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.03" n="3"><l n="a">nojar daśāsya, dumədəl hulu saṅ kakāṅras,</l>
.<l n="b">keṅəl kavantus ibəkan rudhiraṅ mukhābaṅ*.</l>
.<l n="c">ndā* tan haneki matuluṅ*, para devasaṅgha</l>
830<l n="d">ḍyam, nora vanya ri siraṅ daśavaktrarāja.</l>
.<!--<app> (b) Cqz rudhirāmukā-; (c) y ndī; y tumuluṅ.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.04" n="4"><l n="a">ṅhiṅ saṅ prahasta matuluṅ*, dṛḍha* supraṇamya:</l>
.<l n="b">’ḍū saṅ daśāsya parameśvara, hayva maṅkā!</l>
835<l n="c">bhaktinta riṅ bapa maharddhika tolihənta,</l>
.<l n="d">yar matya vaiśravaṇa niṣphala bhagna donya.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) y tumuluṅ; q vṛdha.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.05" n="5"><l n="a">tovin kaparjaya sireki huvus yva* maṅke,</l>
840<l n="b">dṛṣṭopaman kita manəmbuṅ aveha tīrtha.’</l>
.<l n="c">nā liṅ prahasta, maməkul suku saṅ daśāsya,</l>
.<l n="d">mopakṣamāṅalapi daṇḍanirātimarma*.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) y pva; (d) y mahātimarma.</app>-->
. </lg>
845<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.06" n="6"><l n="a">ṅkā padma śaṅkha tumuluy paḍa śīghraśīghra,</l>
.<l n="b">yekāmalayvakən i saṅ dhanarājadeva;</l>
.<l n="c">sampun təke* taman i nandanakānanāglis,</l>
.<l n="d">tan dveki rakva tinuluṅnira saṅ* surendra.</l>
.<!--<app> (c) ADz təkeṅ; (d) z de.</app>-->
850 </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.07" n="7"><l n="a">saṅsipta teki gati saṅ prabhu yakṣanātha,</l>
.<l n="b">ndā tar panūt sira ri saṅ kaka mūr pinuṇḍut;</l>
.<l n="c">ṅhiṅ taṅ vimāna tinavannira bhakty anuṅkul,</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ vastu* mūlya pakalakṣaṇaniṅ jayeṅ praṅ.</l>
855<!--<app> (d) y vastra.</app>-->
. </lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.08" n="8"><l n="a">yekan mahas sira ri deśanikaṅ vanādri;</l>
.<l n="b">kailāsaparvata təlas jinajah təpinya,</l>
.<l n="c">muṅgah muvah sira harəp musirekiṅ agra,</l>
860<l n="d">nandīśvarākhya* mamikalpa mapintu* saṅ hyaṅ</l>
. <!--<app>(d) z Nandīśvareka; ABCq mapantu.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.11.09" n="9"><l n="a">`ai saṅ daśāsya, vali*, hayva vavaṅ manahta</l>
.<l n="b">mahyun tumumpaka ri śṛṅganikaṅ vanādri;</l>
865<l n="c">sugyan, bapaṅku, kita tan vruha yan* bhaṭāra</l>
