.<l n="c">duṣṭaṅ vvil sukha śāraṇeka karaṇanyan pūrva maṅken hilaṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">yekānuṅ matəmah suvṛddhabala mājar yan pəjah saṅ prabhu.’</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.67.03" n="3"><l n="a">nāhan liṅnira, tan dva yar kucurakən taṅ tīrtha śuddhoṣadhi</l>
3320<l n="b">ṅkānery aṅganiraṅ narendramahiṣī mvaṅ taṅ vvaṅ iṅ jro* purī.</l>
.<l n="c">sampun pūrṇa kabeh sameka mahurip, sūkṣmaṅ mahādevatī.</l>
.<l n="d">lvir riṅ svapna hiḍəp narendra lumihat solahnirāṅde ləṅəṅ;</l>
. <!--<app>(b) Cqv i jro.</app>-->
.</lg>
3325<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.67.04" n="4"><l n="a">sakvehniṅ bala vīrayodha kavəṅan de saṅ paratrāgəsaṅ.</l>
.<l n="b">vval vuṅkuk kaka len uveña mahurip madyus mareṅ narmadā,</l>
.<l n="c">mukhya* śrī parameśvarīkin inamər dinyus təkap saṅ prabhu;</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkan himpər maṅure maṇik sira təkap saṅ śrī supatny āgəsaṅ.</l>
. <!--<app>(c) A mukhya ṅ.</app>-->
3330</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.67.05" n="5"><l n="a">ndah maṅke ri huvusnirāhyas ahajə̄ṅ mvaṅ śrī narendrādhipa,</l>
.<l n="b">līlābhūṣaṇa sarvaratna pinarəkniṅ vīrayodhakrama,</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ sakvehikanaṅ vvaṅ adyah i daləm sampun samāhyas marək;</l>
.<l n="d">tuṣṭāmbəknira saṅ narendra lumihat, mājar sire saṅ vini:</l>
3335</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="67" met="jagaddhita" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68">
.<!--Jagaddhita: - - - | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | - ~ - | ~ =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.01" n="1"><l n="a">`rakryan, tan sipi gə̄ni tuṣṭani kakanta ri huripi tuhankv amarbaṅun,</l><l n="b">de saṅ hyaṅhyaṅikaṅ nadīndran umijil, karuṇa siran aveh mahāmṛta;</l><l n="c">āpan byakta pəjah manəhta, yayi*, yan kita tulusa matiṅgal iṅ hulun;</l><l n="d">maṅgəh lvir paṅisī gəluṅ, riṅ apa tan hilaṅa ri hilaṅiṅ patah lukar?</l>
3340 <!-- <app>(c) y rari.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.02" n="2"><l n="a">saṅsiptanya, śarīra* vāhya, baṅun iṅ svapəna hiḍəp i polahiṅ hulun;</l>
.<l n="b">maṅke, svasthani māsku, kady anəmu gandhaniṅ asana ləsəh kakiṅkiṅan.</l>
.<l n="c">ṅke tāri, ndak aṅolakən təṅah avarṇa pəpəsa təkap iṅ payodhara;</l>
3345<l n="d">marma ṅvaṅ ri kitebu, yak pəjaha, tan pakaraṇa ri huripku* riṅ raṇa.</l>
. <!--<app>(a) y sākṣāt tan pasarīra-; (d) huripku: y pəjahku.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.03" n="3"><l n="a">saṅkṣepanya, tuhankun agya ri valuyta, bibi, muvah i paṅkvaniṅ hulun,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅhiṅ tekaṅ sukha śāraṇeki paraniṅ hṛdaya gatinikan turuṅ pəjah,</l>
3350<l n="c">āpan ṅūni ta rakva hetuni patinta* majarakən i līnaniṅ hulun.</l>
.<l n="d">lvāmbək, koṅ asurātiduṣṭa, rarahənku kamu vulikən iṅ vanāśrama*.</l>
. <!--<app>(c) y patinya; (d) y vanāntara.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.04" n="4"><l n="a">yadyan maṅhəta riṅ śivāṇḍa hariloka saparananikeṅ jagattraya,</l>
3355<l n="b">tūtən.’ rakva vuvusnireki; sumahur saṅ ahayu pinakesiniṅ purī:</l>
.<l n="c">`hah sampun, kaka, hayva! tan sukha manəhta ri pəjahanikaṅ mahāsura,</l>
.<l n="d">pintən rakva haneki ṅūni ya pasuṅ mami lara karaṇanya maṅkana.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.05" n="5"><l n="a">lāvan dibya təmən təmahnya ya, baṅun mamagəhi manahiṅ patibrata;</l>
3360<l n="b">āpan ṅvaṅ pəjahe patinta, kita tan ya ta vihikana polahiṅ hulun;</l>
.<l n="c">maṅke byakta təkapta rakva huniṅan, prabhu, gatiniṅ asevakeṅ tilam:</l>
.<l n="d">yadyan janmani janmani ṅvaṅ iki tan saha musapa ri jə̄ṅ nareśvara.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.06" n="6"><l n="a">yekā kāraṇaniṅ hulun vavaṅ ataṅgəh i pəjahanikaṅ durātmaka.</l>
3365<l n="b">suṅsaṅ yan hana sih narendra, maharəp ṅvaṅ umulat i tavanta, bhūpati.’</l>
.<l n="c">`bhoh tenduṅku, sukhaṅ hulun.’ vacana saṅ nṛpati ri sira saṅ nareśvarī.</l>
.<l n="d">śīghra prāpta tikaṅ daśāsya ya kinon parəkakəna təkap nareśvara.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.07" n="7"><l n="a">sampun prāpta ri sanmukhā nṛpati saṅ daśamukha təkaniṅ pamañjaran,</l>
3370<l n="b">tan sah saṅ mapatih prahasta, bala rāsika, ri vuri matuntunan taṅis.</l>
.<l n="c">tuṣṭāmbək parameśvarīki lumihat, kakakaka saha cārakāṅrubuṅ,</l>
.<l n="d">hyunhyun denika ghorarūpa kahiḍəp mṛgapati ya hañar sakeṅ vana.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.68.08" n="8"><l n="a">rəp, śīghran təka tan pasaṅkan inucap lumavad i pamənaṅ saṅ arjuna,</l>
3375<l n="b">khyātīṅ* rāt bhagavān pulastya sira vipraṛṣi subhaga dhātṛjottama,</l>
.<l n="c">kapvāśānti ri jə̄ṅ narendra; naranātha tumuluy atibhakti sādara,</l>
.<l n="d">sampun rakva siran sumambhrama manohara, tinut i sahur dvijeśvara:</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) C khyātī.</app> -->
.</lg>
3380</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="68" met="upajāti" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69">
.<!--Upajāti: = - ~ | - - ~| ~ - ~ | - ~ =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69.01" n="1"><l n="a">`om saṅ narendra, prabhu vīra digjaya</l><l n="b">surūpa dhīrādhika śakti riṅ sarāt,</l><l n="c">bhraṣṭaṅ musuh tan hana maṅgəheṅ raṇa,</l><l n="d">təkapta himpər parameśvarātmaka.</l>
.</lg>
3385<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69.02" n="2"><l n="a">paṅliṅgan iṅ rāvaṇa vīra digjaya</l>
.<l n="b">mahottameṅ śakti ta nora tan vruha,</l>
.<l n="c">sor taṅ vatək devata denya gə̄ṅ galak,</l>
.<l n="d">tuvin tikaṅ rākṣasa daitya dānava,</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) digjaya &lt; digajaya, em. m.c.</app> -->
3390</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69.03" n="3"><l n="a">sakvehnikārəs ya təkap mahāsura,</l>
.<l n="b">tathāpi rakveki kaparjayeṅ raṇa,</l>
.<l n="c">de śrī narendrāṅlaga vīra kottama;</l>
.<l n="d">katon paratranya təkap nareśvara.</l>
3395</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69.04" n="4"><l n="a">tan len yuyut hyaṅ vidhi taṅ mahāsura,</l>
.<l n="b">si rāvaṇeka vruha saṅ nareśvara;</l>
.<l n="c">ndan potrakāṅgəhnya təkap mamīkihən,</l>
.<l n="d">ya donkv anasyā ri huripnike* haji.’</l>
3400 <!-- <app>(d) v -nikeṅ, y nireṅ.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69.05" n="5"><l n="a">liṅ saṅ mahāvipra sirāṅhəmū taṅis,</l>
.<l n="b">vimūrchitāmbəknira mavlas iṅ putu,</l>
.<l n="c">tan ton kaṭuṅkanya mahātiduryaśa</l>
3405<l n="d">sarehnikāṅhiṅ huripanya yākədə̄.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.69.06" n="6"><l n="a">ṅkā śrī narendrādhipa dibya riṅ manah</l>
.<l n="b">sukhe panāsi pravaradvijeśvara;</l>
.<l n="c">yekan kinon taṅ bala vīrayuddhaga</l>
3410<l n="d">kənoha saṅ rāvaṇa teky uvākəna*.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) E2v tenyuvakəna, y tecakənanta.</app> -->
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="69" met="rajanī" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.70">
3415<!--Rajanī: ~ ~ ~ | ~ - ~ | - ~ ~ | ~ - ~ | ~ - ~ | ~ ~-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.70.01" n="1"><l n="a">atha, ri vijil daśāsya saka riṅ vəsi pañjara ya,</l><l n="b">makucəm ikaṅ mukhāvnəs akusut dahat iṅ sivuhən;</l><l n="c">apituvi tan pabhojabañu*, dūra hanan masuṅa</l><l n="d">satəvəkireki rakva kavənaṅ, kadi tan subala.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) F pabhoga-.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.70.02" n="2"><l n="a">təka ta sire harəp nṛpati, tan dva subhakty akaki,</l>
3420<l n="b">tumuluy ikan praṇamya ri narendra pakon suyati;</l>
.<l n="c">muvah ika liṅ dvijendra: `kita nātha*, maṅampunana,</l>
.<l n="d">maṅucapanaṅ daśāsya, majare hayu yogya tutən.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) y nāra.</app> -->
.</lg>
3425<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.70.03" n="3"><l n="a">daśamukha, bhoh, nda hayva kamu māna ri saṅ nṛpati,</l>
.<l n="b">satuduhireki tan vihaṅa kanyu* lanāhiḍəpa;</l>
.<l n="c">yadi masuṅaṅ svarājya kamu tan kapalaṅ ri sira,</l>
.<l n="d">saha suta patnikānuta sumambaha saṅ nṛpati.’</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) kanyu: y rakva.</app> -->
3430</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="70" met="sragdharā" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.71">
.<!--Sragdharā: - - - | - ~ - | - ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | ~ - - | ~ - - | ~ - =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.71.01" n="1">
3435<l n="a">nojar* saṅ vipra; tuṣṭaṅ daśamukha masuṅekaṅ* kaḍatvan ri ləṅkā,</l>
.<l n="b">maṅgəh ṅūnin baṅun liṅ dvija vara; mavuvus śrī* narendrānivārya:</l>
.<l n="c">`he he yakṣendra, tātan sukha kami ri gatintāvvataṅ rājya śobha.</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhiṅ yan tuhvekiṅ ambək, matəlasana kitābuddhi mūrkhāvamāna!</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) ACqz sojar; A masuṅeṅkaṅ; (b) C trī.</app> -->
3440</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.71.02" n="2">
.<l n="a">āpan noreka yogyan gavayakənana de śrī mahābhūminātha;</l>
.<l n="b">mitrādoh, śatru makveh, mamənaṅa tuvi tan dharma kastutyan iṅ rāt;</l>
.<l n="c">maṅkin yan sora dontāsakit ika; huniṅan rakva maṅke təkapta:</l>
3445<l n="d">byaktā tan sah kiteṅ pañjara, yadin aku tan masihe saṅ dvijendra.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.71.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">saṅsiptan, hayva, tātan hana hiniriṅan iṅ vvaṅ təkapniṅ lumampah;</l>
.<l n="b">gə̄ṅ māna vruhvruheṅ śakti parama, tan* ikā buddhya saṅ nītimanta.</l>
3450<l n="c">yadyan ṅvaṅ matya, maṅgəh, lamun anuvukane saṅ mahāsādhu riṅ rāt,</l>
.<l n="d">āpan vvantən tivasniṅ laku, yadi tan ikānuṅ pratiṅkah narendra.</l>
. <!--<app>(b) F paramartan.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.71.04" n="4">
3455<l n="a">siṅgih yan bhūmināthan tayaṅ ulahakəna lena saṅkeṅ parārtha,</l>
.<l n="b">kāruṇyeṅ sarvalokāṅinakana manah iṅ kāsyasih buddhi hīna;</l>
.<l n="c">āpan byakteka don saṅ prabhu sinivi təkapniṅ mahāvīrasaṅgha;</l>
.<l n="d">yan tan maṅkān anindaṅ para rivarivaniṅ muṅsir iṅ rauravāṅga.</l>
.</lg>
3460</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="71" met="jagadnātha" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72">
.<!--Jagatnātha: ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | - ~ - | ~ ~-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">kayogyanika, hayva tan suyaśadharmaṅ ulahakəna, saṅ daśānana,</l>
3465<l n="b">nda tan muvaha mūrkha, sādhu kita; tan pakaraṇa mamatī prabhūttama,</l>
.<l n="c">nda yeka marəneki rakva kaharəpku pakadhana panuṅkuleṅ hulun;</l>
.<l n="d">mahādhana təkapku nora juga lena ləviha saka riṅ jagaddhita.’</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.02" n="2">
3470<l n="a">nahan liṅira saṅ narendra; sukha saṅ daśamukha; mavuvus dvijeśvara;</l>
.<l n="b">`uḍu prabhu, mahottameka kaharəpta, tuhutuhu viśeṣabhūpati;</l>
.<l n="c">apan kramani saṅ narendra juga tan paləpaləh i karakṣaniṅ jagat,</l>
.<l n="d">makāsya sira saṅ munīndra sahaneṅ girivana ya rinakṣa saṅ prabhu.</l>
.</lg>
3475<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.03" n="3">
.<l n="a">sudhīra manahiṅ tapodhara manah nṛpati paramapaṇḍitottama,</l>
.<l n="b">ləyəpni haləpiṅ svarājya giritulya paṅalusani saṅ nareśvara;</l>
.<l n="c">ikaṅ kuhaka duṣṭadurjana ya bañcananika mamaṅun prakampita,</l>
.<l n="d">pənuh mibəki sarvaloka ya baṅun suravaravaniteṅ tapovana.</l>
3480</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.04" n="4">
.<l n="a">dudū marika durgamanya kalavan rusiti manah ikaṅ* surāṅganā,</l>
.<l n="b">hilaṅ pva ya milag kabeh juga lamun hənəṅakəna təkap munīśvara*;</l>
.<l n="c">svajātinikanaṅ durātmaka, yadin hənəṅakəna, makin ta yāvəvəh;</l>
3485<l n="d">mataṅnyan ika hayva saṅ prabhu harəp kasiliba təkapiṅ prabañcana.</l>
. <!-- <app>(a) y i saṅ; (b) y nareśvara.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.05" n="5">
.<l n="a">kunaṅ phalanikeki rakva yadiyan kavaśakəna təkap nareśvara,</l>
3490<l n="b">prabhāvanira* viṣṇumūrti kahiḍəp, sinivi saphala bhūmipālaka;</l>
.<l n="c">pitovi mara saptajanmani tuvuhta niyata matəmah prabhūttama,</l>
.<l n="d">nda tan titisa rakva dibya kavənaṅ titisa juga, paran kasaṅśaya*.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) nira: y kita; (d) q paranta saṅśaya.</app> -->
.</lg>
3495<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.06" n="6">
.<l n="a">apan sira minuṣṭiniṅ japa samādhi, sinamaya ri tuṅtuṅiṅ hiḍəp,</l>
.<l n="b">hiḍəpnira tikāṅhiḍəp, vuvusiran vinuvusakən i saṅ mahāmuni;</l>
.<l n="c">prasiddha sira rāmareṇa təkapiṅ tribhuvana, huripiṅ jagat kabeh,</l>
.<l n="d">ndatan pahi lavan sinādhyanira saṅ viku saṅ inusi saṅ nareśvara.</l>
3500<!--<app> 6d and 7abc are missing in C.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.72.07" n="7">
.<l n="a">*kalīṅanika, yogya dharma kaharəpta, tulusakəna, hayva saṅśaya;</l>
.<l n="b">lavan purihi saṅ narendra juga tan bəsur aməjahanaṅ* durātmaka,</l>
3505<l n="c">səḍəṅ havananiṅ nirātmaka lamun kavənaṅa mara de nareśvara.’</l>
.<l n="d">nahan vacana saṅ dvijendra; sumahur nṛpati paramavīra kottama;</l>
. <!--<app>(b) Ay aməjahikaṅ.</app>-->
.</lg>
.</div>
3510
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="72" met="śārdūlavikrīḍita" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73">
.<!--Śardūlavikrīḍita: - - - | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | - - ~ | - - ~ | =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.01" n="1">
.<l n="a">`he he saṅ paramarṣi, siṅgih ikanojartātiguhyottama,</l>
3515<l n="b">nirbhagnaṅ paramārtha teki ri gatiṅkūn āptya mātīṅ raṇa;</l>
.<l n="c">tovin paṇḍita viṣṇumūrti subhageṅ vīrāntakāniṅ hulun,</l>
.<l n="d">ṅkā tākun muliheṅ śivālaya hələm, muktyaṅ kamāheśvaran.’</l>
. <!--<app>(b) gatiṅkūn &lt; gatiṅkun</app>-->
.</lg>
3520<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.02" n="2"><l n="a">maṅkā denira; tan davākəna, nihan tojarniraṅ rāvaṇa:</l>
.<l n="b">kapvāpakṣa ri don narendra ḍatəṅeṅ ləṅkātiśobhāpura*,</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ saṅ brāhmaṇa yeka rakva parəkən deniṅ sarājyādhika.</l>
.<l n="d">tan maṅgəh prabhu kārtavīrya matulak, monaṅ mahārāvaṇa.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) F -ātiśobha ṅ pura.</app> -->
3525</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.03" n="3"><l n="a">ṅka śrī bhūpati kārtavīrya sira mojar ṅke ri jə̄ṅ saṅ yati:</l>
.<l n="b">`rehniṅ bhūpati māti riṅ raṇa kabeh mvaṅ vīrayodhakrama,</l>
.<l n="c">ndah yekāhuripeki rakva palakuṅkv ānugrahāneṅ hulun,</l>
.<l n="d">sakvehkveh bala rākṣaseka ya pəjah vehən muvah jīvana*.’</l>
3530 <!--<app>(d) F jīva ya.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.04" n="4"><l n="a">liṅ saṅ bhūpati maṅkaneka; sukha saṅ vipra, nda tan laṅghana;</l>
.<l n="b">mvaṅ saṅ rāvaṇa tuṣṭacitta ruməṅə̄ de śrī narendrādhipa.</l>
.<l n="c">rəp, kāgran* humənəṅ dvijendra, tumibāṅ varṣāṅdadak lvir pinəh;</l>
3535<l n="d">drak, yekāṅhuripiṅ matīṅ* raṇa kasiddhyan saṅ mahābrāhmaṇa.</l>
. <!-- <app>(c) y śīghran; (d) qv matī.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.05" n="5"><l n="a">sampun pūrṇa təkeṅ gajāśva ratha len sarvāstra sampun vətəh,</l>
.<l n="b">goṅ kəṇḍaṅ sahaneṅ raṇāṅga ya tumut mvaṅ taṅ mṛdaṅgāsəlur;</l>
3540<l n="c">sampun rakva mulih kabeh marək i jə̄ṅ śrī bhūmināthaprabhu,</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ tekaṅ bala rākṣaseka paḍa bhaktī jə̄ṅniraṅ rāvaṇa.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.06" n="6"><l n="a">tan varṇan ri patūtnirekin umulih saṅ vipra sampun məsat,</l>
.<l n="b">mvaṅ san rāvaṇa mantuk iṅ pura huvus mamvit ri* jə̄ṅ bhūpati.</l>
3545<l n="c">tuṣṭāmbək prabhu hehayāṅśa kalavan saṅ śrī supatnīśvarī,</l>
.<l n="d">de saṅ brāhmaṇa siddhi hetuni huripniṅ vīra mātīṅ* raṇa.</l>
. <!-- <app>(b) ABCqz mamvīt i; (d) C mātī.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.07" n="7">
3550<l n="a">byātītan, ri lavasnireki vəkasan mantuk narendrādhipa;</l>
.<l n="b">sampun prāpta sireṅ mahispati lavan sakveh vatək pārthiva;</l>
.<l n="c">ramyaṅ vvaṅ mavarahvarah ri jayaśatru śrī narendrādhipa,</l>
.<l n="d">len tekaṅ mavarah ri don nṛpati yan krūrāmbəbəṅ narmadā.</l>
.</lg>
3555<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.08" n="8">
.<l n="a">tan ṅeh yan huniṅan gatinya; tucapa śrī hehayāṅśaprabhu,</l>
.<l n="b">svasthaṅ rāt, makətər tikaṅ kujana duṣṭāmbək kaṭuṅkeṅ* jagat,</l>
.<l n="c">mvaṅ tekaṅ bala rākṣasāvədi kumə̄ln ton śakti saṅ bhūpati,</l>
.<l n="d">āpan rakva pinetnireka rinuruh sakvehnikaṅ duryaśa.</l>
3560 <!--<app>(b) Cv kaṭuṅke, q maṭuṅkeṅ.</app>-->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.73.09" n="9">
.<l n="a">lāvan pūja ginə̄ṅ narendra, satatāsuṅ dhāna riṅ rāt kabeh;</l>
.<l n="b">nirdon taṅ dina rātri, dharmapara taṅ pinrih təkapniṅ manah.</l>
3565<l n="c">nāhan hetu bhaṭāra buddha sira harṣan ton sakeṅ tanhana,</l>
.<l n="d">mvaṅ sarvāmara sādhubuddhi maṅaləm de śrī narendrādhipa.</l>
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="73" met="kilayu manəḍəṅ" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.74">
3570<!--Kilayu manədəṅ: - - ~ | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | - -->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.74.01" n="1"><l n="a">nāhan juga valərikanaṅ kathābuka daśāsyacaritan inikət,</l><l n="b">ndān arjunavijaya ṅaranya rakva karəṅə̄ titir inujarakən;</l><l n="c">antuk rasika saṅ aparab mpu tantular amarṇa kakavin alaṅə̄,</l><l n="d">ndātan tular ika ri gatinya tan vruh i rusitniṅ aji milu ləṅəṅ.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.74.02" n="2"><l n="a">lāvan karaṇaniṅ aṅikət palambaṅ, aṅusə̄ṅ tumut aṅapi laṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="b">aṅkən stuti ri pada bhaṭāra viṣṇu sira buddhasakala kahiḍəp</l>
3575<l n="c">rehniṅ daśamukha ya muvah saṅ arjuna suśakti parama riṅ ayun,</l>
.<l n="d">kālih paḍa pəjahika deni janmanira ṅūni subhaga karəṅə̄.</l>
.</lg>
.</div>
.<div type="canto" rend="met" n="74" met="jagaddhita" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.75">
3580<!--Jagaddhita: - - - | ~ ~ - | ~ - ~ | ~ ~ - | ~ ~ ~ | ~ ~ ~ | - ~ - | ~ =-->
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.75.01" n="1"><l n="a">nirdon taṅ śara, śūnyakāya sahananya luməpasa rikaṅ durātmaka;</l><l n="b">aṅhiṅ bāṇa bhaṭāra hetunika naṣṭa, ri patinika śuddha nirmala;</l><l n="c">ndah yekan karaṇanya rakva musiraṅ haripada makavṛtty anindita;</l><l n="d">bhraṣṭaṅ mūrkha kabeh tumiṅhal i rahadyanika pəjah i madhyaniṅ raṇa.</l>
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.75.02" n="2"><l n="a">yekan rakva təvəkniṅ aṅracana parvacarita pinakeṣṭiniṅ maṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="b">tan saṅke vihikan ṅhulun, vvaṅ atimūḍha tunaguṇa, sumevake haji;</l>
3585<l n="c">vāhyādyātmika tan haneki, riṅ apan maṅinakana ri buddhiniṅ tuhan?</l>
.<l n="d">nāhan hetuniṅ aṅgagap tanah, asoṅ karas, aṅituṅi paṅjrahiṅ* səkar.</l>
. <!-- <app>(d) A pajrah.</app> -->
.</lg>
.<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.75.03" n="3"><l n="a">yan bvat tantular olug ambək apa tan sigasigun i panindaniṅ para,</l>
3590<l n="b">tan vruh yan cacadən sapolahika, kevala tuməkani seṣṭiniṅ manah;</l>
.<l n="c">paṅliṅgan paguritnya* nora kəna paṅlipura vuyuṅiṅ adyah iṅ tilam;</l>
.<l n="d">ṅhiṅ tan duhkha cinodya, tan sukhan inastuti guṇanika buddhitāḍana.</l>
. <!--<app>(c) q saguritnya.</app>-->
.</lg>
3595<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.75.04" n="4"><l n="a">siṅgih yan kavi mūḍha tan vruh iṅ iraṅ, salahiḍəp aṅikət pralāpita;</l>
.<l n="b">lud tan śabdika, tan vruh iṅgitaniṅ akṣara gurulaghu canda, tan sphuṭa;</l>
.<l n="c">dūran teki daməlnya yan kahañaṅāṅusira hələm acaṇḍya pustaka,</l>
.<l n="d">deniṅ buddhinirāgamopama gaḍuṅ lumuṅ aharəpa vimbaniṅ vulan.</l>
.</lg>
3600<lg xml:id="arjunaVijaya_01.75.05" n="5"><l n="a">ndā nistanya* titir vināda cinacad ginuyuguyu təkap kavīśvara,</l>
.<l n="b">ṅhiṅ tan simpaṅ ike gatinyan akirim kakavin i dalaniṅ* puḍak sumār.</l>
.<l n="c">saṅsiptan, ri ləsə̄haniṅ bhujagapuṣpa ri śikharanikāmaṅun laṅə̄,</l>
.<l n="d">saṅ sūkṣmeṅ* ləpihan tanah juga panəṅgahanika pinakeṣṭiniṅ maṅə̄.</l>
.<!--<app> (a) CF ndan niṣṭanya; (b) i dala: Aq adala; (d) C sukṣme.</app>-->
3605</lg>
. </div>
. </div>
. <!--VariaE lECtionEs and Colophons

.(Canto a: śārdūlavikrīḍita)
39551. tan varṇan gati saṅ daśāsya kahañaṅ de srl narendrādhipa, devi Citravatī sireki caritan saṅ kāri riṅ narmadā.
.vvantən vvil mavarah (y1: magarah) ri jə̄ṅnira ri līna śrī narendre rana, khyātîṅ rat sukhasāraneki matəmah vvaṅ sādhu, dustā sira.
.2. yekâṅde taṅis iṅ svarājya gumərəh sākṣāt gərəhniṅ pasir, mukhya śrī paramesvarī sira viraṅrvaṅ tan pasabdâsəkəl, ləṅləṅ mar kumətər gupe hatiniran lvir tan pajīvan katon, tan vandhyā kaləṅər sirâlupa ri sambatniṅ kakeṅâtuluṅ.
.3. śīghrodāni sirâharəp tumuture ṅgvan saṅ parātreṅ ayun; taṅgəhni vvil ateki mājar i datəṅ śrī rākṣasendrādhipa, kapvâhyun malapeṅ siran vuvus ika, lvir tuhva bhaktīyana. nāhan hetn niraṅ narendradayitâmə̄k kesa lāvan kuku
.4. donyā rakva məne tibākəna ri jə̄ṅ śrī hehayāṅsaprabhu. maṅkā teki vuvus nireṅ kaka kinon prāpteṅ təgal papraṅan. ndah yekan paṅadəg narendradayitâgyâdan tumūteṅ priya, nirtrsnan paṅure gəluṅ saha luṅidniṅ khadga dlpteṅ taṅan.
39605. ’ah ah he prabhu saṅ kakuṅku, huniṅan sambat mamî jə̄ṅ haji, saṅ sākṣāt harimūrti yan ri laga, rəsniṅ daitya yāksâsura; hyaṅniṅ tāman amindakâpti kahidep rumte jinəm mrik sumar, moktaklesa kətaṅ śarīra ri huvusniṅ makarvan huləs.
.6. maṅke pvå ri pəjahta māti təkap iṅ dustâvamāne haji, tan saṅkeh gunamanta kevala kitâhyun mūra tan ry âvaka. saṅsiptan, prabhu, milva ta ṅhulun ike jə̄ṅ saṅ narendrādhipa, mon svārgā dahatâku denta saparānânut tatan laṅghana.
.7. ali rakryan, palakuṅku leka samanəhteṅ mogha (y1: moya) māyeṅ tavaṅ, suṅsuṅ riṅ garudâtivāhana təkap saṅ sūra mātîṅ rana,
.līlā lālana riṅ triloka, jənək iṅ viṣṇvanda dibyâlaṅə̄, ramyâmūrti bhaṭāra viṣṇu ta kita, ṅvaṅ śri, mahādevatī.’
.8. nāhan liṅ nira, tan dva yar sudukakən tekaṅ carik bhāsvara ṅkāneṅ tvas nira, mumbul asru kumucur mabhrā mahāsobhita. ṅkā ta śrī paramesvarī sira mamūjâṅañjali saṅ sani,
3965lagy âcamana rah nirâsəkar urâvrā riṅ gəluṅ riṅ vijaṅ.
.9. dhyāyī sāksana sunyayoga rinəgəp saṅ śrī supatnîsvari, sampun kempən ikaṅ tricipta pavarah saṅ siddhayogīsvara; yckan rakva tinut nirâṅlahan ikaṅ ratnā ksanârje tutur,
.rəp, prāptaṅ kusuniâṅdadak ruru parəṅ 1vir puspa saṅkeṅ tavaṅ.
.(Canto b: sandyakara)
.1. atha ri pəjah narendradayitā sire patiganiṅ hasokânədəṅ kavəgəgən epu rūpa nikanaṅ kalaṅvan i samīpaniṅ narmadā, pada maṅəsah mar aṅrəs i vuluh gadiṅnya kavudan təkapniṅ barat, kətər i patərnya mandra karəṅə̄, baṅun taṅis ikâlarâsâtələb.
39702. ravi makucəm sameghan akuvu-kuvuṅ riris ikâṅluh iṅ parvata, saha kilat iṅ pətəṅ-pətəṅ ikâsmu kerən i təkap supatnīn pəjah; ṅuni-ṅuni taṅ vvaṅ adyah i dalem kabeh sama paratra belan tumut, makamukha saṅ mamarvani lulut nireki karuhun pəjah riṅ dagan.
.3. sukha ta manah nikā milu mulat ri donya karananya śīghran milag, siva(?) rike narendra sira rakva milva tumuteṅ pəjah saṅ kasih. nda tan ucapən gatinya, caritan narendra kārtavīrya mantuk sira, saha bala kosa vahana mahātighora laku saṅ vatək hehaya.
.4. girivana durga marganira ṅūni rakva ya tinut təkap bhūpati, ksana tumuluy datəṅ sira ri narmadā hənah ira supatnī pəjah. vvaliṅ ira rakva nuṅsuṅa hajə̄ṅ nirâmapaga riṅ vulat kan lulut, mamuhara tan kadî lagi ya rūpa rūksa mavənəs, kapaṅgih pəjah.
.5. kaka-kaka len uveṅa magəlar bule val ika kuñja sampun pəjah, karanani saṅ narendra maṅaṅən jəṅər kahənəṅan təkap saṅ padəm, muvah ikanaṅ pravīra pada keməṅan maṅən i don ikâṅde ləṅəṅ; vəkasan ateki tan dva humatur tikaṅ vvaṅ inutus supatnī pəjah:
.64, id) tan ilu riṅ: dinulur iṅ y. 2c) maṅumpul a.

.the Colophons of the manuscripts
4000a iti kakavin hārjunavījāya samaptā, pūrnā linikita sədaṅ iṅ vve, kujja sita.
.b ity Ârjunavijaya saṅkathā, putus iṅandun riṅ dinā śu, pa, hugu, titi, sasih, ka 6, paṅ piṅ, 4, rah 6, təṅgək 4.
.C ity Ârjunavijaya saṅkathā, kīrtinira mpu tantular, uttamaniṅ kavīsvara riṅ yavadvipa. pūrna linikita riṅ pulo lombok, ṅkāneṅ paṅlāhan iṅ rājya jivā, de saṅ hantən, paryantusakəna virūpaniṅ āksara, de saṅ sudhy âmaca. i śakāla, iti: ah putraṅkv iki hūrya hastaku tâlapta rasa pitu viku vvaṅ aṅləṅə̄ṅ, sākṣāt jaṅga ri kala vesakamasan tan avaṅi nika, patra kevala, kāṅkən cihnani sūklaniṅ tvas aku rī kitan aku ri hanaṅkv i pañcaka, byaktanyâr paran iṅ manahku ri rarasta saphala tuhu gurvan iṅ manis. i rika divasaniṅ pustaka putus. oṅ sarasvatye bho nama svahā; oṅ siddhir astu, dirghayuh astu, tat astu, astu ya nama svahā.
.d ity Ârjunavijaya kathā suramyâlaṅə̄, nārānamā satrini ptu(?) silpānaha\vani, ṅā(?) drokacandra huddasi vovarānyamatal, iri ṅka jahnavi tutug durgan ātinurun// ṅkānerikaṅ pulina pañjya hardda mahaləp, ṅka hane vvaitanira saṅka livātiphalā, mvaṅ ka ri pascima ri rika vai ya mavighna, pāryyanirâhuvussa saṅ maṅgaleṅ manobha// thatan agəṅ rəna ri hājəṅ hunāndikarā, pan holihira hatipiṅgiṅ unākalusan, harddā kədə̄ milv anurat da tanpāmavarum, aṅhiṅ makapalimur hati sokasakuṅ// ma, 6, rudhīra hastami, mastaka saptami. aum sarāsvatyai namah; aum gmum ganapataye namah, auni gurubhyo namah.
.E ity Ãrjunavijaya samāpta, tlas (s)inurat riṅ dinā, ka, vrə, manahir tīithī, ka, 6, rah, 6, təṅ, 6, sūklapāksa riṅ trayodasī. de saṅ āparab pamuragil hayvātmāja, pāryantusaknā virūpaniṅ haksarā, tan pendah lvir cākār iṅ ralatha, deniṅ hakveh kaləṅə̄r, yen tuna ləvih, pihajəṅən de saṅ sudhy âmaca, apí.n hantuk iṅ strī muda tan tama. uṅ dirgghāyur astu saṅ amaca, ləvih saṅ anurat.
4005F təlas iṅ carita. ity Ârjunavijaya samāpta. huvus pvekīṅ lambaṅ sinurat riṅ kala 3, vrə, duṅulan, taṅ, piṅ, 8, sasih 1.
.v ity Ârjunāvijaya kathā surāmya rāras, maṅken təlas linikitəṅ lurah iṅ dārbodā, hapan dahāt handulur iṅ bhavetniṅ aksara, tan vruh yan cinacad iṅ para dibya ninda// ksāmākəne gatiniṅ āksara dūrlikita, tovi ksayanya ṅuniveh atiksayanika, apan təkapniṅ atimuda kuraṅ viveka, nirlajja kevala kədə̄ panamuny
.sokā// .......... ntavamotatunakāravannavana ya dharake dalem hati, yâṅde
.sorinikiṅ svacitta riṅ apan maṅinaki manah iṅ kəneṅ nunə̄ṅ, ṅhiṅ tan suddha lulutkv i samulaharatradasala ya maveh pa …, paṅlāmpun mapabuddhi kosvatânut an harəp agavayaṅ ārtha nindita.
.l itikârjunavijayā samapta təlas tinulad, jə̄ṅ ira saṅ hyaṅ hardhipa mrihan, gəgə̄ kavasənā riṅ puja rərəṅga himbaṅ harṣanya bhatur pan slanikā sesih paryyāntusakəna, deni tidāni sāstrā haguṅ viloṅkaraṅasa, prasadunira saṅ anulis deniṅ sāstra hagə̄ṅ alit hapinda ṅlagəṅ kārahatan lagha satulis kabhrāja, rehniṅ voṅ kātida kumavi milvā manulad, sugyan hañjrah hiṅ para bhasa, hāṅag-haṅug hamaprabhaṅgā, padāvikāradura sambhadha, viruda bhasā virudā ləṅkara virūda vesva kalaṅan tava, hāpa canda hapra gandā, yati bhraṣṭā hapāksara, cedaksara saṅgathā pralapa, srutti kāsta dusprāgrətti, punika prasabənira saṅ anulis, rehniṅ voṅ tita grāhita sara, gə̄ṅ kanistādama kasikasihaniṅ suksma, sāmpun tan cupət iṅ paṅapura rəke mivah taṅ madrəvva riṅ pustaka, yen vvantən sudy amaca.
4010vara divasa kahuvusan, vu, kulavu, 5, pa, 7, soma, 6, vas, 3, va, pha(?), 9 ludra, 4 laṅa, da nohan. titi mansa dvidasi krsnapaksaniṅ phalguna, i sākala diyaṅ 6, 5, 5, 3, 5, 6, 5, 7(?)
.oṅ śrī śvarasvatiya nama svahah. oṅ śrī girisutaya namasohah. oṅ śrī yamadipatiya namasohah.’
.m ri sah iṅ cinitra kaṅ kagəṅan śrī nrpatmaja, ri dite vage purnama kahastaniṅ vuye, rəjəp, jimmaval, saṅkalanni vaktra sah iṅ sapta juga, sitaniṅ lokapala kan tinèdak iṅ abdi juru citra pun naravita, tinədak sinuṅgiṅ dahat tan vrin iṅ gita krama kavi vet iṅ muda dama.
.Cod. or 3634:
.ity hārjunavijaya kārtha. antuk iṅhandun, varā, pa, su, sinta, parantuk satrapon, denira saṅ sukā haṅvilani, yan loṅkavotānna, holih iṅ mudda, bvat kaprapañca kasaputan roga. kan andun, parab punnyamanta, riṅ haṅsokā, lor iṅ marga guṅ, tlas sinurat, riṅ dina, ka, 8, krsnapaksa, riṅ tritya, rah tuṅgal, təṅgək, 7.
4015
.
.92
.-->
. <div type="translation" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02">
4020
.<div xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.01"><ab xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.01.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.01.01">May there be no hindrance!</ab></div>
.<div type="canto" n="1" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.01" n="1">Hail! To the god Parvatarāja, the life of all the vital spirits of the vorld ;*
.Who is the very image of Buddha, the supreme reality, who is firmly held in meditation by the perfect yogins;
4025Who is like the nectar to vise souls, but poison to great sinners;
.Who passes unhindered throughout the vorld as [the radiance of] the sun passes through clear vater.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.02" n="2">The purpose of my praise to the Lord is to implore Him to pay heed to the reverential homage of one who devotes himself to poetry,
.So that the carrier of the dark coloured case may achieve the perfect goal he sets himself in vriting, — this is what I implore, as I build my temple of language on my vriting leaf;
4030It is the velfare of the kings of Java and its princes and princesses that I have in mind,*
.Long may they live, saṅ Paməkas-iṅ-Tuṣṭa first of all, may they be secure in their palaces.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.03" n="3">The reason that I have the audacity to attempt to vrite a lengthy story * — even though, compared to those who are as the moon in The art of poetry, I am only a little star — *
.Is that I hope it may serve to repay the debt that the king’s kindness has imposed upon me, a poet.*
4035It is śrī Raṇamaṅgala alone who condescends to allow me to enter his presence.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.04" n="4">Nov, he is the son of the brother of Lord Wəkas-niṅ-Sukha,*
.And furthermore he has now become the son-in-lav of the younger sister of the King of kings.*
.It is fitting therefore that he becomes my patron now that I render a prose narrative into a poem in quatrains,
4040He who is the very embodiment of the fourth season, and who is never far from my side .
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.05" n="5">This is the beginning of the story, so let those who wish to enjoy the art of poetry listen.*
.In former times there was a king who belonged to the family of the king of demons,
.A descendant of the god Padmayoni, grandson of Pulastya, and a son of sage Wiśrava;
4045His name was Rāvaṇa, and he was renovned throughout the vorld for his provess and pover in battle.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.06" n="6">The vorld lay in ruins, all creatures trembled in fear, and all the deities were in disarray,
.Because the vicked demon king, whose pover was without equal, was on the rampage [throughout the vorld].
.The story goes after the slaying of the demons Mālī and Mālyavān in battle
4050By the god Harimūrti, their army was poverless, and [as a result of this defeat] many of them sought refuge in the nether vorld.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.07" n="7">This episode is followed by Dhaneśvara being securely enthroned in Ləṅkā,
.Because his father had told him that the well.established, most beautiful kingdom of Ləṅkā was now deserted;*
.He wandered at ease over the shores and mountains, or flev to Heaven from the palace,
4055always in his chariot, escorted by the demons.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.08" n="8">One day Sumāli emerged into the vorld of mortals to try to outvit [the gods]
.— he was none other than the brother of the great demons who had escaped the great Keśava.
.He was filled with pleasure at the sight of lord Waiśravaṇa, a god with most excellent auspicious marks,
4060For truly the son of Wiśrava was renovned for his provess and virtues.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.09" n="9">This gave Sumāli thought, and he then decided to make the sage Wiśrava his son-in-lav,
.So that he (the sage) might have children equal to Waiśravaṇa, whom he now took as his ideal,
.And at the same time increase the progeny of the Sukeśa family of the great demon race.
4065May they be perfect and faultless [he thought] so that they will be able to withstand the attack of god Keśava in the future var.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.10" n="10">In a flash he reached the nether-vorld, and told his daughter [of his wish].*
.She, the excellent maiden Kaikeśī, was obedient to her father,
.And so assumed a form unlike that of a descendant of the great demons;*
4070As a goddess in visible form descending into the vorld, she came into the presence of the sage.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.11" n="11">However, the sage of sublime mind knev well the purpose of this beautiful maiden;*
.It was the conceiving of children that filled her mind. Inadvertently she arrived vhile he was engaged in his devotions;
.He therefore granted her these favours: she would give birth to a lion-bodied son,
4075Rāvaṇa, who would be terrible in appearance, as he would have ten faces and tventy svinging arms;
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.12" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.12" n="12">As for her second child, his ears would be as large as cooking pots, hence his name would be Kumbhakarna;
.Ave-inspiring, he would look like a mountain, huge and tall, and his eyes would be like suns.
.Then, there would be [a third child], with sharp pointed nails resembling vinnoving baskets,
4080She would be none other than the great female demon called Śūrpanakhā.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.13" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.13" n="13">Such were the favours the great sage offered her. Kaikeśī replied to the sage
.That she wished to give birth [also] to a son who would be like him, a god incarnate.
.’So be it! The youngest will be equal to me’, said Wiśrava,
4085’he shall be free from the evil of anger, hence his name will be Wibhīṣaṇa, and he will have the soul of a sage.’*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.14" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.14" n="14">We do not describe the marriage: These four children had now been born.
.They practised asceticism, performing yoga assiduously and murmuring mantras constantly.
.And Dhaneśvara, who was Rāvaṇa’s older [half-] brother, advised,
4090And urged his younger brothers to acquire great favours and told them to go
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.15" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.15" n="15">To a mountain named Gokarṇa, where a most excellent hermitage was established;
.The vay there was difficult and perilous, but Rāvaṇa vent there, accompanied by his brothers.
.There the excellent Kumbhakarṇa sipped drops of dev, and svallowed them,
4095While he remained motionless for one thousand years, striving for God’s protection.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.16" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.16" n="16">As for Wibhīṣaṇa, he was not will.ng to be surpassed by his older brother;
.Whether in yoga, in meditation, or in any other [form of asceticism] he would not be outdone.
.Daśavaktra was different: he performed yoga and recited mantras for ten thousand years.
4100And after each thousand years, without fail he severed one of his heads and offered it in sacrifice;*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.17" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.17" n="17">These offerings were placed in the pot, when the god Śivāgni was blazing.
.When all his heads but one had been sacrificed, and his principal head was about to be sacrificed,
.The god Dhātṛ and all the accompanying gods shoved their delight at the sight of these ascetical practices,*
4105And, lo, he reached Daśāsya in a flash and prevented him [from severing it].
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.18" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.18" n="18">’Nov, nov, my grandson, do not do thus! What is your wish?
.Whatever wish you have, I shall not shrink [from granting it], because of your great determination.’
.Thus spoke the Lord, and Rāvaṇa replied: ’With all my respect,*
4110I velcome you, O my Lord, if you wish to grant me a favour.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.19" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.19" n="19">Let me not be slain by the eagles, serpents, the marvellous vil,
.Dānava, daitya, rākṣasa, nor by the celestial musicians and fairies,
.Not to mention the hosts of gods; and let the whole earth, sky and heaven be submissive to me;
4115Let none of them dare to oppose me, and let them be destroyed, if they persist in opposing me in battle.’
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.20" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.20" n="20">’So be it!’ thus the Lord spoke, in granting the most heroic one all his requests.
.’And I shall grant you more favours: your body will be perfect again, your heads will be as numerous as before;
.And further you will be able to assume at will vhatever form you wish;
4120You will have the pover of mayabañcana [that is to say] the ability to make yourself invisible in battle, and to be skilled in all the guiles of var.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.21" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.21" n="21">And nov, my great-grandson Wibhīṣaṇa, what is your wish?
.Even though you are just as much a demon as your brother, take care that your wish be not evil.’*
.’O my Lord,’ said Wibhīṣaṇa, ’it will not be so, for I have no such inclination; *
4125I wish only to be loved by others, to be an embodiment of dharma.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.22" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.22" n="22">As the moon is encompassed by its radiant beams,
.So may my body be encompassed by all virtues, causing delight to the beholders forever;
.May I always perform asceticism without difficulty, and strive for righteousness.
4130Protect this [virtue of mine], O, my Lord, so that I shall be steadfast in tranquility of mind.’
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.23" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.23" n="23">Hearing all his wishes, the god Brahmā, full of joy, granted his requests, saying:
.’And moreover you will not be influenced by the vicked nature of the demons.’
.Thus he spoke, bestoving on him an additional favour; then the god turned to Kumbhakarṇa,
4135Who was like Kāla in his great meditation directed to the destruction of the vorld.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.24" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.24" n="24">All the deities accompanying the god Brahmā were perplexed,
.Because he now wished to grant Kumbhakarṇa an excellent favour.
.’As Kumbhakarṇa is already supremely formidable, he will be even more superior to the deities;
4140And with his huge size and his might, who, among the gods, will be his equal?’
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.02.25" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.02.25" n="25">Thus spoke the gods, but the god Jagatkāraṇa did not accept their plea,*
.For it was not the Lord who caused a creature to gain pover or fall into insignificance;
.It was nothing but the product of his ovn karma that had brought about the Lord’s affection.
4145And therefore the god descended and approached Kumbhakarṇa.</p>
.
.</div>
.<div type="canto" n="2" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.01" n="1">While the gods were perplexed and in despair
4150Because the god Jagatkāraṇa was adamant,
.Let us now tell of Sarasvatī,
.The vise and intelligent consort of the god Widhi.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.02" n="2">The deities quickly made their vay*
4155To the tongue of the excellent Kumbhakarṇa.
.There the goddesses uttered vords [as though coming from him] in contradiction
.To what he wished when the Lord inquired of him [his desire].
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.03" n="3">’May I fall into a deep slumber,’ he seemed to say,
4160’And not vake for thousands of years.’
.The Lord granted his request
.For [a period of] uninterrupted sleep, without equal.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.04" n="4">After a vhile the Lord departed and
4165Vanished with all the gods delightfully,
.And Sarasvatī flev out
.From the mouth of the excellent Kumbhakarṇa.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.05" n="5">As for the demon Kumbhakarṇa,
4170He was left to himself in anguish, speechless and perplexed,
.Because he had requested what he did not wish for,
.And thus was different from his ovn two brothers.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.06" n="6">And this was why he slept without interruption,
4175And did not witness the conduct of king Daśavaktra,
.Who was very poverful and terrible,*
.Who desired nothing but to destroy and shatter the vital spirit of all creatures and the triple vorld,
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.07" n="7">For there was no god that he regarded as his Lord;
4180All creatures, men and others were reduced to ashes,
.They were depressed and submissive to him.
.It was because of the excellent favours [he had von] that he was so poverful.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.03.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.03.08" n="8">The palace called Ləṅkā,
4185where his brother (Dhaneśvara) lived, he seized.
.So Dhaneśvara left the palace,
.and Daśāsya succeeded to the throne of Ləṅkā.
.
.</p></div>
4190<div type="canto" n="3" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.01" n="1">The city of Ləṅkā was as beautiful as Mount Meru, terrifying and avesome ;*
.Graceful and spacious on the summit of Mount Trikuṭa, it was built of gold studded with jewels;
.There was a deep river encircling the palace, like a turbulent sea;*
.Pandanus trees were blossoming, their flowers hanging dovn from the white stones which looked like rocks.
4195</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.02" n="2">The high valls were made of black stone, inlaid with sapphires and nine kinds of jewels; *
.There were four gates; they were like mountains of fire, because they were of polished golden bricks;
.They were nine storeys high, each of them perfectly carved;
.Their tops were a blaze of light gloving in the sky, resembling Mṛtyu assembled.
4200</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.03" n="3">The splendid vaṅuntur-yard lay before [the gate], it was spacious and level, exactly like a battlefield;
.On all sides of the market-place there were long, large buildings, where the troops assembled.
.Within, the spectacle was even more wonderful, the audience hall was crovded;
.The pavilion with meru stood out in the vataṅan-yard;
4205</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.04" n="4">The palm fibre roofs were like black clouds, topped with jewels, glittering like lightning;
.It was crovded with demon soldiers and officers, such as taṇḍa, subala and pamukha.
.The nearby stables for elephants and horses were also lofty in appearance;
.The trumpeting of elephants and the neighing of horses sounded as if [warriors were engaged in] stabbing each other and exchanging blovs in hand-to-hand combat.
4210</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.05" n="5">Even more beautiful and beyond compare was the arrangement of the palace; the interior was most imposing,
.Because of the radiantly sparkling crystal-pavilions; some of them, which were [as bright] as if it was continually daytime,
.Were like the abode of Smara transported thither when he vanished into the sky;
.And the sleeping quarters of Daśamukha were like the abode of Śiva.
4215</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.06" n="6">The courtyard was splendid and well.kept, its sand was of radiant, crushed rubies;
.The paved slopes were of opals and jewels, in appearance like beautiful stars, illuminating the ground,
.And the bright faces of the peerless ladies of the court were as bright as the moon,*
.[And so the courtyard vas] like the second firmament at sunset, when the sun dimmed in the sky.
4220</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.07" n="7">All around there were many kinds of flowers, some just in bud, others blossoming in abundance.
.As [flowers] in a picture remain either blossoming or in bud for ever,
.So in this garden, the flowers never withered but ever increased the beauty [of the palace] ;
.The sun itself was mellowed on reaching there, as though terrified of Daśamukha’s officers.
4225</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.08" n="8">Limpid streams floved dovn the hill slopes, and flowers were in full bloom along the banks;
.The vater [of these streams] sprang from the mouth of a statue of Gajendramukha in furious anger,
.Which was placed under the heavenly coral tree; vhirling his trunk,
.He looked avesome and terrible, like the god Gaṇa bent on destroying the vorld.
4230</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.09" n="9">The streams floved into the great river that encircled the city, and thence floved into the Royal household,
.As well as the houses of the female servants and nurses, greatly enhancing the beauty of the palace.
.Thus the palace was like Mount Mandara in the midst of the ocean, its beauty was magical,
.And the thunderous voice of the great demon (Daśamukha) appeared muted.
4235</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.10" n="10">Were ve to describe the beauty of the city [ve should say] it resembled that of Paśupati,
.Gracefully looking in all directions as far as the mountains, the sea and the forests;
.And the army quarters did not appear [to be such]*
.For they looked like heaven transported thither, or like the abode of Indra, or that of Baruṇa.
4240</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.04.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.04.11" n="11">To the north of Daśamukha’s palace was that of Wibhīṣaṇa;
.It was like the abode of Wiṣṇu: the jewels sparkled like kaustubha-jewels, shining into the sky.
.To the south there was a palace like the abode of Dhātṛ, blazing like a mountain of gold;
.here the great demon Kumbhakarṇa slept, — he had not yet avakened.
4245
.</p></div>
.<div type="canto" n="4" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.01" n="1">It would take too long to describe the marvellous beauty of the splendid city of Ləṅkā,
.So let us now tell of the demon king who was pondering on the supremacy of his pover in this vorld:
4250It would not be until he had destroyed the earth, sky and heaven, reduced the serpents and men to ashes,
.And vanquished the deities in heaven, that his might in battle would be proved.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.02" n="2">This was why the fearful Daśamukha came out from his private quarters,
.And all the demons paid him homage, as he came to speak to his officers, tributary kings and warriors.*
4255Then he seated himself in the palanquin studded with jewels,*
.While the beautiful garments, the lion-throne and the splendid pillows were set in readiness.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.03" n="3">All the hosts of demons were seated on the ground, no one was absent;
.A great number of ogres, shouting aloud in unison, were packed together with the giant soldiers;
4260Foremost among them was minister Prahasta, the superior, whom the dreadful demon had appointed first minister;
.He sat on the terrace in front of Daśamukha, formidable in appearance.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.04" n="4">When the milling crovds of demons had assembled, the large palace appeared too small,
.Because a hundred million of these dreadful officers filled the main courtyard to capacity.
4265Then arrived an envoy from Dhanapati, named Gomukha, having the appearance of a demon;*
.He brought a letter, and read it aloud to Rāvaṇa, so that the latter could hear the message.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.05" n="5">’O king Daśāsya, you who are the Lord of this kingdom of Ləṅkā,
.Who are like Brahmā in visible form in this vorld, dreaded by all the deities, and without equal.
4270I am grieved, my brother, both on account of your pover and your virtue — resulting from the favours God has bestoved upon you —*
.That you have no forbearance tovards others, no love for the poor and destitute.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.06" n="6">For indeed, the purpose of flavless virtue is to eliminate the defilements of the whole vorld;
.The role of the king is to care for the priests, and to perform irresistible service to the Gods.
4275But since you have not conducted yourself in this vay, chaos is spreading in heaven and the hermitages,
.As is evident from the most vicked manner in which you drove me out from here.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.07" n="7">In brief, do not behave in such a manner any longer, and cease being
.foolish and arrogant; * strive for the dharma, for the revard of a king in this vorld of mortals
4280is to be loved by his people. You should follow my example; I always performed the most virtuous
.dharma in this vorld, and from the moment I did so Lord Īsvara, who is now like an esteemed friend, loved me.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.08" n="8">Thus should be your behaviour; bear in mind that you are a son of
.Brahmā’s line, invincible; so do not behave in the manner of great demons, but be steadfastly com-passionate.
4285And let us hope, my dear brother, that you may have the good fortune
.to be permitted to join the company of all the deities, that you may [henceforth] come together with me to the feet of the great Nīlakantha.’ *
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.09" n="9">Thus were the vords of the eldest brother in his letter. Rāvaṇa replied, his lips trembling with anger:
.’Shame upon that despicable and base Dhanapati, who censures me as ferocious and vicked;
4290he himself is blind to his ovn vickedness, for he had attempted to usurp this very kingdom of Ləṅkā;
.but since this is my kingdom, which I inherited from my mother, I could not restrain myself from reclaiming it by force.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.10" n="10">now he orders me to be on good terms with the king of the gods and the celestial musicians!
.It is impossible for the king of birds to befriend and keep company with the terrible king of serpents.
4295Moreover, the most vicked god Wiṣṇu is my arch-foe.
.Hov could I, if I befriended Artheśvara, remain the most poverful in this vorld?
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.11" n="11">He is both foolish and ignorant, that is why he wished to befriend a malicious foe.
.I beg your leave, but there is nothing better for me to do now than to attack heaven.*
4300Even if all the deities and all the inhabitants of heaven were to come to his aid,
.Or even if Lord Īśvara were the enemy’s protector, I would not vaver.’ *
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.12" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.12" n="12">Thus spoke the demon king, abusing Lokapāla vehemently.
.Then sviftly he grasped his candrahāsa-svord, and severed the envoy’s neck.
4305His blood spurted high, and the head flev into the air like that of Rāhu, as he exclaimed [saying]:
.’Aha, you, king of the demons, in time to come an envoy will reduce your palace to ashes!’
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.13" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.13" n="13">Rāvaṇa, increasingly enraged by the envoy’s curse, choked with fury;
.And when the head fell to the ground he urged his demons to devour both it and the trunk.
4310Then he quickly retired to make preparations to attack Dhanendra, fore-most among the kings.
.’He is to be exterminated’, thus Daśāsya commanded his ministers, tributary kings and officers.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.14" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.14" n="14">All the company of demons shouted thunderously, as they heard the nevs
.That their king was to set forth to attack his elder brother.
4315And so they hastily made ready the elephants, the horses and the chariots, arming themselves with veapons, arrows and thunderbolts;
.Gongs and kettledrums boomed, and the sound of the beaten musical instruments mingled with the din of the shouting army.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.15" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.15" n="15">A great number of spirited and courageous warriors packed the market-place, so that there was no open space left,
.And the senior ministers arranged themselves in the vaṅuntur-yard ready for combat.
4320Sviftly they prostrated themselves the moment the great demon king made his appearance,
.Riding in his huge seven-storeyed chariot resplendent with crystals.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.16" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.16" n="16">Then the dreadful demon king, at the sight of the preparations of those frightful heroes,
.Whose tusk-veapons were flaming like Kāla together with Mṛtyu,
4325[Said to himself]: ’It will be a wonder, O Lokapāla, if you can withstand against all these heroes! Where can you seek refuge?
.Even if you flee to the great heaven or to the abode of Wiṣṇu, you will be pursued.’
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.05.17" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.05.17" n="17">Thus spoke Rāvaṇa to himself, and at length he ordered the hosts of heroes to set out.
.Then the elephants and the chariots made a clamour as the terrible great demons set out;
4330Some brandished their spears, thunderbolts and discuses, so that the on-lookers trembled with fear;
.Others moved through the air, shouting aloud with the sound of a hundred million thunderbolts.
.
.</p></div>
.<div type="canto" n="5" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06">
4335<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.01" n="1">The courageous Dhūmrākṣa was appointed to lead the column,
.And riding in his sparkling jewelled chariot he was formidable in appearance;
.He vore a diadem, a necklace and a garland of sparkling jewels,
.And in his hand was a mighty svord, sharp and gleaming.
.</p>
4340<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.02" n="2">His crovded soldiers shouted tumultuously; they were demons of all kinds: *
.Wvil, bhūta, yakṣa, dānava and añja-añja,
.As well as trunks with their heads flying before them,
.Their blazing eyes bulging from their sockets, and their red tongues protruding from their mouths.
.</p>
4345<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.03" n="3">Following behind Dhūmrākṣa was Bajramuṣṭi, victorious over the three vorlds;
.His elephant was white in colour, like Airāvaṇa,
.Its four tusks were ablaze, gloving like Mṛtyu,
.And its trunk, brandishing a spear, was like a dreadful serpent.
.</p>
4350<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.04" n="4">Ave-inspiring, he stood on the back of his elephant,
.Svinging a sun-like discus which he held in his right hand;
.Accompanied by multitudes of his troops, who were formidable in appearance,
.[One wonders]: ’What heaven would not be destroyed, if they ranged over it?’
.</p>
4355<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.05" n="5">Then Supārśva set out in his jewelled chariot
.Like a wild lion at the sight of a spirited elephant in rut;
.He carried with him a javelin which was of great magical pover,
.Which continually issued forth blazing arrows of fire.
.</p>
4360<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.06" n="6">A hundred of his troops were mounted on elephants, all of them eager for battle;
.Tventy thousand of them were marching sviftly;
.Like all-engulfing floods and thunderstorms,
.They destroyed the mountains they traversed, reducing them to dust.
.</p>
4365<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.07" n="7">A moment later Akampana mounted his magnificent horse,
.Which now flev through the air, then galloped on the earth;
.He became invisible, then at length he was to be seen dismounting
.From his horse and, like Indra, mounting an elephant.
.</p>
4370<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.08" n="8">Some of his demon soldiers looked like the excellent king of the kinnara,
.Others were well.built like the gods and demi-gods*
.— The only difference was that when they grinned their tusks were terrifying,
.And their eyes were round, gloving red like the red lotus.
.</p>
4375<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.09" n="9">Then the hideous Prakopa set out, in appearance like Kāla,*
.Blazing like a mountain of fire because of his raiment;
.His necklace was a great serpent, mighty and poverful, [which cried]: ’ṅak, ṅak’,
.His tusks shone together with his sharp-pointed veapon.
.</p>
4380<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.06.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.06.10" n="10">He was mounted on a huge and fierce white elephant which trumpeted violently;
.Ever in his right hand was his infallible veapon, which he brandished;
.The boom and roar of thunder vent before him.
.And two billion shouting heroes followed him.
.
4385</p></div>
.<div type="canto" n="6" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.01" n="1">Then the marvellous Rāvaṇa himself set out as the rear-guard of the army; *
.Seated in a horse-dravn chariot preceded by two elephants,*
.He was in truth like the god Kālarudra bent on the total destruction of the three vorlds,*
4390His eyes aglov with the devouring fire of anger.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.02" n="2">Thousands upon thousands of demon kings escorted him,
.Foremost among them the senior minister Prahasta, with a bow at the ready in his hand;
.His lofty, demon-faced elephant was terrifying, its sharp-pointed tusks were flashing;
4395His red banner fluttered, flaming and blazing as though about to consume the vorld.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.03" n="3">The eruptions burst upvards, mountains collapsed and wooded hills moved like surging vaves.
.The movements of the terrible demon army of Ləṅkā when they marched out,*
.Are not described; the demons had now reached the foothills of Mount Kailāśa,
4400Spreading throughout the fields, filling even the mountain groves.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.04" n="4">Taken by surprise, the demons living in the neighbourhood of Mount Kailāśa were poverless,
.And fled seeking refuge into Lokapāla’s palace, trembling with fear at the enemy’s arrival;
.And [they said]: ’The demon king in a fury has slain the envoy.’
4405Thus were their vords, informing the noble god Artheśvara [of what had happened].
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.05" n="5">Then Lokapāla reflected upon the difficulty of the course he had to take:
.It was because of his love [for Rāvaṇa] that this happened, for after all
.He was Rāvaṇa’s eldest brother; yet even if he withdrev nov, he would suffer misfortune; [vhat he had done is] to be compared with attempting to help a dog and getting bitten [for his pains] ; *
4410In vain had been all his noble and just vords, because of Rāvaṇa’s foolishness and vickedness.
.
.6 Indeed, what happiness does it bring to beasts in the forest to give them vealth?
.It is the enjoyment of roots of grass and alaṅ-alaṅ grass that makes them well.content.
.And monkeys are far from pleased by gifts of gold, ornaments and jewels,
4415For they are attracted only by fruit which they regard as truly precious.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.06" n="7">Similarly the swine; hov can they enjoy various perfumes?
.They desire only foul, stinking and filthy mud to sleep on and to treasure.
.And thus was the nature of Daśāsya; he was bent on varfare, for he was an inveterate rogue;
4420He abominated the dharma, because the demon-family from his mother’s side had incited him [to evil] .*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.07" n="8">This was why Dhanendra ordered all the officers to engage the foe,
.Namely: Yogandhī and Wiṣṇu, the celebrated chiefs of army,*
.Padma, Śaṅkha, Duśśāsana, Kaluṣasadā, Durkāla, Kubala,
4425Cakrāsya, Krodha, Bajra, Agada, Paraśu, Bala, Abala and Anala.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.08" n="9">The whole army quickly assembled in the open square, eager to fight;
.The hosts of demons were innumerable, all were armed with sharp veapons of various kinds;
.They shouted violently, the musical instruments boomed, mingled with the confusing noise of the gongs and drums;
4430Then as soon as Daśamukha reached the great market place, the battle was joined.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.09" n="10">Clenching their teeth, the company of heroes rushed forward menacingly;
.Each side fell upon the other ferociously — all were the descendants of Danu —, becoming intermingled, yelling and screaming violently;
.Some of them mounted their elephants and chariots, and attacked boldly, showering the foe with their arrows, stabbing them and shooting at them with their blovpipes;
4435Other ferocious demons flev in the air, in appearance like fighting eagles.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.10" n="11">The battle raged even more furiously; it was as though the mountains were shattered to pieces, and the earth shook,
.Because those formidable heroes of great provess were innumerable;
.They were engaged in close combat, issuing hosts of demons
4440And various kinds of veapons from their mouths, raging like blazing fire.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.11" n="12">This was why the number of casualties was avesome, and the bodies were piled up mountain high;
.The daylight suddenly disappeared as the dust svirled around, and as blood engulfed the battlefield it became pitch black.
.The ferocious heroes striving for fame mounted their attacks even more furiously over the mountain of bodies;
4445Tvo billion were annihilated, and the army of the demon king fled the battlefield.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.12" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.12" n="13">Then Bajramuṣṭi sviftly turned his elephant to make a fierce counter-attack ;
.Dhūmrākṣa, Akampana and Wikaṭa with all their troops charged forward again and again;
.And all the great demon chiefs too attacked together, stabbing and overvhelming the enemy;
4450And so the army of Waiśravaṇa was rendered poverless, and was viped out without any resistance.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.13" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.13" n="14">Then the formidable Rāvaṇa, armed with a mace, alighted
.From the throne chariot and struck at his enemies, and ten thousand of them were slain;
.At the same time the most valiant Suptāghna pressed forward from the flank,
4455So that Waktrāsya and all his troops fell in battle, their heads cut off.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.14" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.14" n="15">Struck by an unceasing shower of mighty arrows, Waiśravaṇa’s army was broken to pieces, and hard-pressed
.By the heroic Prahasta, Anala, Pavana and Wirūpākṣa who were inflamed with passion.
.Enraged, Wiṣṇu immediately brandished his mace, struck the enemies with it, and pursued them;
4460And Yogandhī began mercilessly to batter the Ləṅkā army and to crush them to pieces.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.15" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.15" n="16">Rāvaṇa’s army was undaunted at the sight of the two wonderful heroes who pressed forward to the attack;
.They were precisely like tvin Kāla, the more they were attacked, the more they struck back at the enemies, yelling and screaming.
.Mārīca’s chariot was shattered to pieces by the blovs, and his horses were crushed;
4465Sviftly he leapt from the chariot, whereupon Dhūmrākṣa pressed onvard, discharging his arrows.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.16" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.16" n="17">Then an arrow struck Wiṣṇu’s side, blood spurted out, gushing from the wound and poured dovn;
.Yogandhī was enraged, but Suptāghna attacked and slev him.
.The din of the army of Waiśravaṇa was even more thunderous, the soldiers trampled upon one another in confusion as they attempted to flee the battlefield;
4470They were routed, sviftly pursued and slain, their bodies heaped up in front of the palace.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.17" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.17" n="18">Then the marvellous Rāvaṇa sviftly scaled the high vall from the outside;
.He slev the yakṣa who guarded the gate, and severed his head;
.Then he flev to the gate and pushed it hard, it collapsed killing those crushed beneath it.
4475All the demons screamed and shouted thunderously, their voices boomed, reaching even to the Interior of the palace.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.07.18" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.07.18" n="19">Moreover, the blazing fire issuing from the demon king’s right hand raged savagely;
.It burnt dovn the palace, reducing it to ashes, and flared into the alun-alun.
.And the hosts of demons shouted thunderously and violently as they encircled the palace,
4480Rushing forward from the east, the north, the south, as well as from the vest.
.
.</p></div>
.<div type="canto" n="7" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.01" n="1">Let us now tell of the god Waiśravaṇa who had remained in the Interior of the palace;
4485He was astonished on seeing the arrival of the brave Rāvaṇa;
.He wished he had come out to fight before, but there was nothing he could do as his chariot Puṣpaka
.Had flovn to heaven carrying all the beautiful ladies to safety; only now had it returned.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.02" n="2">And so, overvhelmed with incessant anger, he fiercely
4490Mounted his chariot, arming himself with a most terrifying bow;
.Attired in blazing, brilliant, beautiful ornaments of fine crystal,
.He looked like the god Harimūrti flying on the valiant king of the birds.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.03" n="3">In throngs the demons gathered round Waiśravaṇa as he made his appearance,
4495And Citrāyudha and Citrācapa, commanders of the host of the gods, stood in their chariots;
.In the vanguard was the first minister Maṇīndra, mounted on his elephant, pressing onvard;
.His army of tventy thousand heroic warriors launched their attacks, and the demons [of Ləṅkā] were held in check.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.04" n="4">The blazing fire that raged in the palace was now extinguished
4500Because the first minister (Maṇīndra) had sent a shower of excellent rain-arrows;
.And the great demons who encircled the palace had all been exterminated
.Because Citrāyudha and Citrācapa had fired their arrows from the sky, rendering the demons poverless.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.05" n="5">Then the fearful army of Rāvaṇa pressed forward again furiously and attacked at close range,
4505But Maṇīndra slev ten million of them at a time with his arrows.
.And so the hero named Dhūmrākṣa quickly made a counter-attack,
.And felled Citrāyudha and Citracāpa with the blovs of his mace.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.06" n="6">And the first minister (Maṇīndra), foremost among them, had also fallen in battle,
4510Slain by Śāraṇa and Tuṣṭa.*
.This was why Dhanarāja’s army fled in terror, at great speed and in disorder,
.The bodies of the slain piled up, millions of them, celestial musicians and fairies.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.08.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.08.07" n="7">now Dhanarāja was the only one left alive, all the other heroes had fallen in battle;
4515Mounted on his chariot he pressed forward, blazing like Mṛtyu.
.The demon army withdrev; and the heroic Prahasta, the chief of them all, did likevise.
.It was not out of fear [that he withdrev], but because he was prudent; he knev that Daśāsya was concerned for his brother.*
.
.</p></div>
4520<div type="canto" n="8" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.01" n="1">’Whoosh’, was the sound of Rāvaṇa’s wonderful chariot rushing along perfectly
.As he encountered Dhanendra, who showered him with arrows, uttering blood-curdling screams.
.Dhanendra fired his most excellent arrow, that of Rudra, and discharged blazing mountains of fire,
.But they were all destroyed, svept aside by the demon king.
4525</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.02" n="2">Likevise, Daśāsya destroyed all the eagle-, serpent- and elephant-arrows,
.Not to mention the bhūta-, yakṣa- and asura-arrows, all of which he trampled to pieces.
.The only veapon Dhanendra had not used to strike his terrible and valiant foe was his mace,
.Which he had received from the god Rudra a long time before, because Rudra held him as a valued friend in the vorld.
4530</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.03" n="3">And so the wonderful Lokapāla sviftly leapt dovn from his chariot, roaring aloud like a lion:
.’Shame upon you, wretched demon! Feel the blovs of this mace which will follow you even to Rorava-hell.’
.Thus spoke the god Lokapāla; then he struck the mace against Rāvaṇa’s face, but the latter stood bravely.
.Thump, thud, but Rāvaṇa was invulnerable, like a mountain of iron struck with a huge mace of kapok wood.
4535</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.04" n="4">Then the furious Daśāsya fought back, he svung his mace, and now both were smiting each other with their maces;
.They exchanged blovs, both were skilled in parrying, courageous as well as fearless;
.They hurled themselves on each other fiercely and were locked in close combat, their shouts resounding like thunderbolts clashing with each other,
.Destroying the trees, the gates and the houses in the Royal compound.
4540</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.05" n="5">A great number of the golden pavilions were flung into the air and broken into pieces, their jewels scattered in all directions,
.Trees were uprooted, flowers withered, and the coral trees were torn up as if struck by a vhirlvind;
.The women of the palace were in confusion, and terror-struck, exhausted and distressed they burst into tears;
.They were carried off their feet and flung into the air when the two heroes, engaged in close combat and smiting at each other, came into the palace.
4545</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.06" n="6">Constantly each tried to outvit the other, svooping around the palace, each attacking the other;
.They looked wonderful, like two dreadful serpents intertvining, neither inferior in pover to the other;
.All kinds of veapons issuing from their terrible bodies flashed around violently
.And fire from their left hands blazed up like the sweeping vind of doomsday.
4550</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.07" n="7">Many invincible veapons were blunted, viped out and rendered poverless,
.For Artheśvara and Daśamukha varded all of them off, hurling them into the distance;
.But the earth shook, the mountains collapsed, and anything they struck was reduced to ashes;*
.The wild game and lions were in confusion, the seas were churned up, the fishes and sea-monsters were crushed.
4555</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.08" n="8">Such was the chaos and the devastation that the two formidable heroes brought to the vorld.
.They pressed each other to the ground, locked in close combat; then they flev to heaven,
.And destroying anything they set foot upon; taken by surprise the gods fled in terror with the goddesses to the vorld of Rudra,
.While the women of heaven sought refuge in inaccessible, solitary houses.*
4560</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.09" n="9">At the sight of Rāvaṇa and Dhanendra, the god Śakra spoke:
.’Do not bring your anger here! I beg you, return and fight your var in the vorld of mortals,
.For surely the heaven will be ruined, perhaps even the deities and their works.’
.And so Dhanendra and Daśāsya moved to the mountain [Mahāmeru].
4565</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.10" n="10">Smitten, the great mountain collapsed, its black-stones were shattered and broken to pieces,
.And the fire issuing from them burst into a shower of sparks which reduced the trees to ashes.
.Mount Mahāmeru shook as the two poverful heroes trod upon it;
.The inhabitants of the forest, foremost among them the hermits, were terrified, and they screamed as fire consumed them.
4570</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.11" n="11">And so the great hermits in the hermitages, the gods and others,*
.Asked them to move to another battlefield, lest the mountain might crumble to pieces.
.At once they plunged into the sea, still fighting in close combat; the fishes were poverless and crushed,
.Junks and pelaṅ boats were vrecked and sank, and the screams of the merchants were tumultuous and deafening.
4575</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.12" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.12" n="12">In addition dolphins, porpoises, sharks and bākapə-fish were killed
.By the incessant showers of all kinds of veapons which made the sea boiling hot.*
.In a tvinkling the god Baruṇa appeared, and asked the two fighting heroes to move on;
.With a terrible boom they moved on to dry land, then descended [to the nether-vorld] ; the terrified serpents were in uproar;*
4580</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.09.13" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.09.13" n="13">The earth quaked and shook, and the seven hells were as if riven apart, they svayed so violently.
.Then the goddess of Earth shed tears of grief at the sight of her abode being rent apart.
.Thereupon both of them sviftly returned to the palace where they had fought hand-to-hand before,
.And there they found the hosts of demons who were amazed at the sight of these two wonderful heroes.
4585
.</p></div>
.<div type="canto" n="9" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.10">
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.10.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.10.01" n="1">While they were boldly striking and stabbing at each other in the course of the long battle in close combat,
.Neither yielding, as they were equally mighty, dexterous and poverful in battle,
4590Daśāsya suddenly vanished into the sky without any trace,
.And the kingdom was enveloped in pitch darkness and a hurricane raged violently.
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.10.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.10.02" n="2">Dhanarāja was frustrated and bewildered, and he lost consciousness because of the deafening noises in the four quarters;
.Therefore, it was impossible for him to see the enemy, let alone pursue him;
4595He could only hear Daśāsya’s booming voice in the sky, horrible like thunder,
.Just as the sound of thunder [re-echoing] at the sight of a vicked person committing evil vhile the rain is falling incessantly.*
.</p>
.<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.10.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.10.03" n="3">Suddenly Daśāsya descended from the sky and cruelly struck at his elder brother,
.Who was exhausted, distressed and unable to see Rāvaṇa coming to strike him.
4600And so Dhaneśvara fell forward to the ground, and Daśāsya ceaselessly showered him with blovs,
.And contemptuously tugged at his hair, screaming furiously:
.
.</p></div>
.<div type="canto" n="10" xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11">
4605<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.01" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.01" n="1">̀Shame upon you, dog Dhaneśvara, wretched dog!
.Nov, take the consequences of criticising others,
.Of offering devotions to the deities, belittling the great demons,
.And of coveting the kingdom of Ləṅkā.
.</p>
4610<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.02" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.02" n="2">Shame upon you, this is the end [of your life], you, who have a virtuous mind,
.And who arrogantly boast to be the friend of Rudra.
.Nov, if the Lord really favours you, show your provess,
.I am sure I can destroy you, despite all your efforts.’
.</p>
4615<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.03" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.03" n="3">Thus spoke Daśāsya; then he kicked his brother’s head violently,
.Pressed him and beat his face against the ground, so that it became red with blood.
.Not a soul rendered him any help; the gods
.Remained silent, no one dared to oppose Daśāsya.
.</p>
4620<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.04" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.04" n="4">It was Prahasta alone who came to Dhaneśvara’s aid; respectfully but firmly he said:
.̀̀̉̀̉̀̀̉O, Daśāsya, supreme lord, do not do thus.
.Remember the devotion you ove to your father, the great sage;
.Should Waiśravaṇa die, [your father’s pover] will be broken and useless.*
.</p>
4625<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.05" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.05" n="5">Moreover, since Waiśravaṇa is now already defeated,
.he is in the position of one who, suffering from thirst, asks for vater.’*
.Thus spoke Prahasta, embracing Daśāsya’s feet;
.And asking for mercy on Waiśravaṇa, he gently took avay Daśāsya’s mace.
.</p>
4630<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.06" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.06" n="6">Then Padma and Śaṅkha sviftly
.Carried god Dhanarāja to safety;
.Soon they reached the garden of the Nandana-woods,
.And the god Indra tended him without delay.
.</p>
4635<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.07" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.07" n="7">In short, this was the conduct of the demon king:
.He did not pursue his brother who was carried avay,
.But he seized his chariot which surrendered itself to him meekly,
.As well as many valuables, as tokens of his victory.
.</p>
4640<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.08" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.08" n="8">Then Daśāsya roamed about in the regions of the wooded mountain;
.Having traversed the slopes of Mount Kailāsa,
.He began to climb it again intending to reach the summit,
.But the guard of the God named Nandīśvara attempted to dissuade him:
.</p>
4645<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.09" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.09" n="9">’Hey, Daśāsya, go back! Abandon your rash
.Desire to climb to the peak of this wooded mountain;
.Perhaps, young man, you do not know that the Lord
.Is lying there with Umā, foremost among the goddesses.
.</p>
4650<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.10" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.10" n="10">Moreover, the nature of this mountain is such that from ancient times
.Not even Indra, foremost among the gods, has been allowed to climb to the peak.*
.So, Daśavaktra, go dovn,
.For you will surely come to grief if you rashly persist.’
.</p>
4655<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.11" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.11" n="11">Thus spoke the guard. Daśavaktra immediately leapt
.From his chariot, and laughed at him contemptuously
.As he looked on his monkey head and animal appearance.*
.And so the guard cursed Daśāsya in anger:
.</p>
4660<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.12" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.12" n="12">’Hey, Daśāsya, you [have committed the sin] of despising others by laughing at my appearance.
.Therefore, in time to come, monkeys will destroy your kingdom of Ləṅkā
.And exterminate all your kinsfolk as well.’
.Thus he spoke; and Daśavaktra was now furious.
.</p>
4665<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.13" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.13" n="13">Ferociously clenching his teeth, he put his hands under the base of Mount Girīndra,*
.And took it in his arms, intending to destroy it completely.
.The Lord, who had just finished making love, was startled,
.And Pārvatī, who was exhausted, had not even put on her kain.
.</p>
4670<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.14" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.14" n="14">The hermits living on the slopes of the mountain were agitated and distressed,
.The lions and bears fled in opposite directions.
.Knoving the reason for what was happening, the Lord carefully
.Pressed dovn the peak of the mountain with the big toe of his left foot.
.</p>
4675<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.15" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.15" n="15">In short, Daśāsya’s arms were trapped under the mountain,
.And he was not able to move them.
.now he was all the more determined to pull them out, but he could not move them;
.Furiously he cursed, and screamed aloud.
.</p>
4680<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.16" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.16" n="16">The three vorlds were stunned by his great voice;
.The gods and others were astounded, and their shouts could be heard even from the vorld of Śiva,
.For his voice was most terrible, booming like turbulent sea,
.In truth like the sound of a hundred thousand thunderbolts clashing at the same time.
.</p>
4685<p xml:id="arjunaVijaya_02.11.17" corresp="#arjunaVijaya_01.11.17" n="17">The god Jagatguru grinned with delight,
